column1: back of a length and slanted in on off stump, Tamim hangs back and blunts the ball to the covers
back of a length and swings into Tamim, who falls over the flick and squirts an inside edge onto the thigh pad
short of a length and outside off, Tamim throws his bat at the ball and slashes it over the top of the cordon, Tamim is assisted by the wind as the ball flies to the third man boundary
back of a length and largely holds its line outside off, tip-and-run single to cover
very full and speared on off, no lateral movement, jabbed to cover
full outswinger outside off, the left-hander covers his off stump and shoulders arms
very full and angled across off, no shot offered
full tempter wide outside off, no lateral movement, Tamim shoulders arms. He isn't tempted yet
full and angling away just outside off, Tamim attempts to drive on the up through the covers. This swung back in slightly, grazed the inside edge and rolled away towards midwicket
pitched up and seaming away outside off, Tamim prods and watches the ball pass the outside edge
back of a length, hits the deck, seams away and opens Tamim up. Poked to cover
full and straight, cross-seamer, Tamim looks to flick. Checks his shot and chips in the air, in front of mid-on
full and holds its line on off, 136.1ks, tapped into the covers for a single
back of a length, Tamim loves width outside off. He does not hold back. Slashes and gets it between second and third slip
and again, this time square through the off side. Boult looking a bit rusty. Back of a length and hung up wide outside off, flayed away to the boundary. Tamim and Kayes knock gloves
short of a length and outside off, fended away towards point
But Boult keeps bowling short. The line is outside off, Tamim stands tall and forces the ball in the gap at extra cover
much fuller and slanted into the left-hander, Tamim has a crease-bound waft as an inside edge rolls back down the pitch
full and swings back in slightly, inches forward and plays it back to Southee
yorker just a shade outside off, jams his bat down and gets an inside edge that rolls past the leg stump
pitched up on off, blocked to cover

Southee follows three full balls with a shoulder-high short ball on leg stump and strikes. Chest-high catch for square-ish long leg. Digs it into the middle of the surface. Kayes attempts a hook, he is not in control of it, and top-edges it in the air to Boult
bouncer, bursts off the surface, greets Mominul, who ducks under it
good length and on a set of stumps outside off, left alone
good length and angled in, punched through midwicket
and Boult errs in line and length again. Short and outside off, flayed away through square cover for a boundary. That's Tamim's fourth four v Boult
full on off, gets forward and defends to cover
good length and holds its line outside off, Tamim plays inside the line and lets it go
pitched up and outside off, ignored
too full on middle and leg, clipped away through midwicket on the front foot. Tamim's fifth four off Boult. He has raced away to 25 off 21 balls. Boult has been either too short or too full
full on off, clipped away to square leg
very full and wide outside off, left alone

full length and seams away outside off, just outside off, bursts off the surface, and beats the outside edge. Mominul had to play. Chest-high grab for Watling. Another attempted cross-seamer from Southee
good length and angled across off, he does not bother with it
Southee tests Mominul with a chest-high short ball on middle. He flaps a pull over square leg. First runs off Southee after 17 balls
full and hung up on a set of stumps outside off, the batsman covers his off stump and lets it pass
pitched up and on a fourth-stump line, Mominul shuffles across off and drives the ball to mid-on
nice and full on middle, 121.8ks, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length and angling away outside off, Mominul thought about playing before belatedly letting it go
much fuller and wider outside off, covers the off stump and ignores it
shorter and slanting away outside off, Mominul watches it through to Watling
veering into the pads, flicked away to long leg. Momninul stumbles at the non-striker's end, and has to settle with a single
back of a length on middle and leg, hangs back and pushes the ball to midwicket
full and on a fifth-sixth stump line outside off, left alone
back of a length and outside off, left alone, excellent carry to the keeper. Chest-high grab
bouncer on the leg stump, Monimul watches it well and hunkers down
back of a length, pitches on middle, and seams away sharply outside off, another cross-seamer from Southee. Hits the shoulder of the bat and dies in front of Taylor at first slip
back of a length and slanted across off, left alone
full on middle and leg, bunted to midwicket
half-volley outside off, Tamim plonks his front foot forward and middles a drive to the bowler's right. Hits through mid-off
back of a length and outside off, flayed away to cover on the back foot
banged in on leg stump, Tamim rolls his wrists and pulls to deep square leg
full and angling away outside off, left alone
full and wide outside off, leftalone again
back of a length on middle, gets across off and turns the ball to midwicket
shoulder-high short ball on the leg stump, Tamim hooks down to long leg
dug short into the middle of the surface, Mominul lifts his bat skyward and cops a blow on the hip. The ball rolls behind square
back of a length, rears up, and seams away outside off, whizzing past the helmet of Mominul. Cracking delivery. Mominul spars at it and is beaten
short and outside off, this is left alone
very full and angled in from around the stumps, Tamim plays across the line and falls over. The angle was taking the ball down leg. Easy call for umpire Erasmus
short ball on leg stump, leaps at the chest. Awkwardly fended square on the leg side

another appeal for leg-before. This appears closer.... and Williamson reviews. Full, starts outside off, and angles in to rap the front pad below the knee-roll. Tamim pushes a long way in front of his body. Impact: in line, snicko picks up nothing. Tamim is beaten on the inside edge. Ball-tracking returns umpire's call on leg stump. Just clipping the top of leg
lifter outside off, Tamim has his eyes locked on the ball before swaying his upper body out of the way
full and seams back in from outside off, the inside edge sneaks away through square leg
back of a length and angled in, fended back down the pitch
full again, pushed back down the pitch
Tamim continues to play his shots. Banged in short on middle, aimed at the chest, Tamim sizes it up, and hooks it over backward square leg although he did not time it properly
floated up and holds its line on middle, 123ks, blocked solidly on the front foot
Tamim has raced to 40 off 39 balls. Wide half-volley outside off, leans forward and crunches a drive through the covers
follows the half-volley with a chest-high short ball, Tamim gets on top of it and pulls it over square leg
dug in short and angled outside off from around the stumps, Tamim hops and quells it to cover
full and outside off, drives away from the body and skews an inside edge to midwicket
floats a wide half-volley outside off, Tamim leans into another drive, sends the ball scurrying through the covers
good length and outside off, left alone
dragged down short and outside off, just 127.5ks, Tamim has ample time to rock back and pull it fiercely over midwicket
pitched up and outside off, presses forward and drives straight to mid-off
length and outside off, left alone
bouncer on leg stump, ducks under it safely
full and angling across off, half-volley, driven straight of mid-off. Tamim would have pasted it through the covers
good length and angling away outside off, Tamim opens the face and dabs with soft hands to gully
overpitched and outside off, cracks another front-foot drive through the covers for a buccaneering fifty. Hit on the up. He has scored 52 out of Bangladesh's 56
bouncer on leg stump, 131.6ks, Mominul gets under it
full, angled in, and swings away, Tamim eyes a leg-side flick. Falls over and thickly edges it, threads the cordon

Boult catches Tamim on the move. Big shout for lbw. Not given by umpire Erasmus. NZ go up for another review. Full and veers in - this one swings back in a bit after the previous delivery swung away - Tamim plays down the wrong line. There was an inside edge, but impact front pad first. Ball-tracking shows it would have carried to hit the top of middle. Umpire Erasmus overturns his on-field call. Well done, Williamson. Well done, Boult. He was taken for seven fours in 19 balls by Tamim. He now nabs the opener lbw
good length and curling away outside off with bounce. Mahmudullah plays inside the line and lets it go
and again! Good length and leaves Mahmudullah again. He has a loose waft and misses. He had to play; it was pretty close to off
wide enough outside off to leave this length ball angled across
back of a length on middle, tapped into the covers
back of a length and angling away outside off, right in the slot for the cut. Slapped away on the back foot through backward point. Hit in the air, but no protection there
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
bouncer on leg, ducks under it
short and angling away outside off, diffused to cover
back of a length and seaming away outside off, no shot offered
poked to point
full on middle, better channel from Boult. Worked defensively to midwicket
bouncer, angling away outside off, Mahmudullah arches his back and lets it ball pass over to Watling
left alone outside off
holds its line outside off, no shot offered again
back of a length and outside off, punchily played to the covers
back of a length and angled down leg, wayward delivery, Mominul leaves it
good length and angling away outside off, not a half-volley, presses forward and pushes through mid-off
Southee's first ball to a right-hander. Full and angled in, defended down to mid-on

very full and and on off, pushed to mid-on for a scampered single. Wagner hunts the ball down, aims a throw at the non-striker's end. Mahmudullah dives full-length, he is struck flush on the unprotected area near the back of the hand. Mahmudullah had to run around Southee
bouncer on leg stump, ducks under it
full on off, swings away, opens up Mahmudullah. Prodded to cover off the outside edge
back of a length and angling away outside off, crisply punched in the gap between point and gully
full on leg stump, hangs back and deflects the ball to square leg
short and angled into the left-hander, played back to the bowler
full and curls in, the batsman plays across the line. Bounces from a full length and thuds into the back thigh
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Mominul swishes at it and watches the ball sail past the outside edge
pitched up and angling away outside off, left alone
back of a length and seams in, glanced to long leg
full and outside off, Mominul shuffles across off, covers his stumps, and leaves it
full and outside off, swings in, does not threaten off, left alone
hurled short on leg stump, flaps a pull over square leg. Mominul hustled for pace and bounce
full and shapes away outside off, squares up the batsman who pokes an outside edge to gully
back of a length and angled into the hips, clipped to midwicket
half-volley, angled into the pads, whipped away crisply over midwicket
Boult retorts with a bouncer outside off, Mominul ducks under it
back of a length on off, hangs back and pushes the ball to cover
short and wide outside off, leans back and cuts it away in the air over point
Boult overcorrects. Overshoots this full ball on off stump, Mominul shows the full face of the bat and drives the ball straight of mid-off. Three fours in the over
'yes Wags' is the cry from behind the stumps. Nice and full outside off, moves away after pitching. Beaten
back of a length and seams away outside off, Mahmudullah is opened up. Prodded to point
full and angling away outside off, ends on a set of stumps outside off or probably wider. Left alone
pitched up on off, front-foot push to mid-off
Wagner runs in hard, hits the deck harder. Bouncer sails over the ducking batsman
good length and angling across off, Mahmudullah leaves it be
full on leg stump, chips carelessly in the air. The ball lands in front of midwicket
length ball on off, shuffles across and taps the ball to the leg side
short and wide outside off, the left-hander is airborne as he aims an expansive cut. The ball jumps over the top edge en route to Watling
good length and angled in, driven to midwicket
back of a length on off, hits 140ks, defended back to the bowler
whipped to square leg, Monimul sets off for a run, Mahmudullah sends him back. He has to undo his steps, dives full-length, there isn't a direct hit
teasing full ball, angling away outside off. Mahmudullah plays away from the body. Plays a loose drive and outside-edges it. It lands in front of Raval, diving to his right, at second slip
waist-high short ball on leg stump, stylishly pulled to long leg
back of a length and outside off, swung away to mid-on
full and angling away wide outside off, Mahmudullah plays away from the body. Jabbing drive through the covers
bouncer just outside off, ducks under it
length-ball indipper, Mominul hops and ends up taking a blow on the thigh
back of a length and nipping away outside off past the outside edge. Nearly 140ks. Mahmudullah simply stuck his bat out in the channel
back of a length and outside off, left alone now
full and angling away just a shade outside off, jabbed back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, punchily driven into the ground, bounces up and over the covers
back of a length and slanted across off, left alone
worked off the pads to midwicket
bouncer, angled in, sways his upper body out of the way
another bouncer, Mominul watches it carefully and rocks his head out of the way
back of a length and outside off, stands tall and punches into the covers
left alone outside off
full and angling away outside off, ignored
length and angling away outside off, ignored
good length and angled across off from over the wicket, left alone
angling away, much closer to off, but not close enough to make Mominul play
good length and slanting away outside off, Mominul shoulders arms again
short on the leg stump, Mominul helps it fine on its way. Minimalist touch. The boundaries continue to flow for Bangladesh
full on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
full and angling away outside off, Mominul drives it handsomely to the left of extra cover. Skips away to the boundary. The visitors pass 100. The drink will taste sweeter for Mominul and Bangladesh
full and just a shade outside off, no shot offered
back of a length on middle, played to the covers
dug in short, aimed at the helmet, swivels on the back foot and pulls down to long leg
banged short and outside off, Mominul can't keep the pull down, but gets it wide of Southee at leg-gully
full and angled across off, Mahmudullah lifts his bat skyward and leaves
good length and angling away outside off, no shot offered
very full and outside off, squeezed back to Southee off the inside half
half-volley outside off, Mominul pushes forward and creams it through the covers. Driven with authority again
back of a length and seaming away outside off, Mominul pulls his bat inside the line and lets it go

dug in short on the leg stump, cramps the batsman for room. Top-edges a hook against the bouncer over the wicketkeeper's head. Thuds into the sightscreen with the wind and falls back into the field of play
short and wide outside off, angling away, Mominul is up on his tippy toes as he steers the ball deftly through point
good length and angling away outside off, Mahmudullah shoulders arms
back of a length and on the stumps, guided with soft hands to cover
good length and seams away outside off, Mahmudullah is opened up slightly as he pokes out to cover
dug short on middle and leg, swivels on the back foot and neatly controls a pull to long leg for a single
full on middle, push-driven back to Wagner
full and holds its line outside off, Mominul wafts away from the body and watches the ball go past the outside edge
floated full and on a fifth-stump line outside off, ignored
back of a length and width outside off at only 126ks, Mahmudullah jumps onto it and punches it serenely through point
very full and on the legs, put away very fine on the leg side with a glance
length and outside off, plays with soft hands, gliding the ball to gully
full on a fifth-stump line, tight stuff, no shot offered
good length and angled into a solid defence back to de Grandhomme
good length and outside off, gently glided in the gap between point and gully. Mominul acknowledges his fifty
very full and tantalisingly close to off, brave leave from Mominul
back of a length and straight in line, worked to backward square leg on the back foot
Wagner turns to the wicked short ball, bounces over a ducking Mominul
another bouncer, angled in, an unruffled Mominul hunkers down
clipped off the hips to the right of square leg
overpitched and outside off, leans into the drive, lovely poise. Driven along the ground to Southee at sweeper
fuller, angled in on off, solidly defended to cover by Mahmudullah
back of a length and outside off, leans back and slices the ball to third man
full and angling away outside off, the left-hander drives away from the body as an outside edge rolls away through point. Santner mops up in the deep
pretty full on off, driven well but straight to mid-on
good length and outside off, wide ball, aims to drive on the up. Ends up slicing it between gully and point
136ks lifter, Mominul was probably expecting this response from Wagner. Ducks under it with no fuss
good length and holds its line outside off, left alone
length and outside off, Mominul shelves the big drive and ignores it
full and angled down the leg side past the glance. Watling is also concentrating. Throws himself to his right, full-length dive to grasp the ball
clipped off the hips to the right of square leg
back of a length and sliding past the leg stump, sliding past a flick. A little tickle could have fetched another four
good length on off, steps back and across to knock the ball to midwicket
back of a length on off, camps back and pushes to midwicket again
tight line on off stump, tight defence from Mominul, with the head over the ball
good length and holds its line outside off, ignored
bouncer on middle, Mahmudullah sinks under the climbing ball
short on leg stump, cramps up the right-hander for room. Awkwardly deflected away to the left of leg-gully
short and angled across, got on top of the ball and pulled down to long leg
back of a length on the stumps, turned to the right of midwicket
hammers one more into the middle of the deck, soars over to the keeper as Mominul ducks under it
banged in, Mominul pulls and top-edges the ball past leg-gully
left alone outside off
full on off, pushed to cover
back of a length and outside off, left alone again
back of a length and angled in on off stump, Mominul shows off his straight-bat push
that nearly sliced Mominul into half! Good length, starts outside off, and seams back in viciously, beats the inside edge. Ripper from Boult, against the run of play
good length and on a fifth-stump line outside off, no shot offered
full and angling across the right-hander. Nothing doing from Mahmudullah
full and outside off, drives or rather mis-hits it off the inside half to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, jab-like defence to gully
good length and ducks back in off the seam, screams past the inside edge of Mahmudullah who simply hung his bat out

follows the inducker with a very wide delivery - it would have missed a set of stumps outside off. Mahmudullah throws his bat at the ball and throws his wicket away after doing all the hard work. Slashes a long way away from his body and sends a thick edge behind. Watling dives full-length to his right and pouches a smart catch. NZ needed the breakthrough and Wagner provides it
full and outside off, Shakib watches it through to the keeper
pretty full on middle and leg, flicked nicely to long leg
full and outside off, Shakib shoulders arms
full on the leg stump, defended
bouncer outside off, Shakib half-sways and half-ducks out of the way
pitched up on off, Shakib moves forward and solidly pushes the ball to cover
back of a length and outside off, punched out to the left of point
full on off, tip-and-run single to cover
full inswinger, starts outside off and comes in slightly, defended back with a straight bat
Shakib joins the boundary-hitting spree. Hurrying short ball on off stump, Shakib attempts a pull and sends a top edge fluttering over backward square leg
full and angled in, shuffles across and defends to leg

Dropped by Santner at square leg. He was probably late to pick up the ball. Short of a length and outside off, Shakib can't control another pull. He (mis)hits it in the air. Flies to Santner at chest-height. His head falls back as he goes for the catch with both hands, but the ball bobbles out
full and straight, flicked away through midwicket
very full on off, curls in, flicks and inside-edges the ball through the vacant spaces at backward square leg
full on a fourth-stump line, driven down the ground. Boult dives full-length to his wrong side and stops the ball. Excellent work
full and angled into the pads, flicked away to the left of mid-on

a chance for a run-out. Straying into the pads again, nudged to square leg. Latham moves to his left from short midwicket, hunts the ball down. But falls back as he releases the ball. Misses a direct hit. A brief mix-up between Shakib and Mominul, but they have enough time to recover. Tentative start from Bangladesh on day two
good length and holds its line outside off, Mominul sensibly leaves it be
back of a length on off, played back to the bowler
very full and angling across off, left alone
length and angling away outside off, Shakib lets it go again
Southee probes away outside off, Shakib does not bite
very full on the stumps, Shakib presses forward and drives it back to Southee who collects the ball and has a shy at the stumps. Hits Shakib's calf and puts his hand up in apology right away
a bit too full and outside off, Shakib drives on the rise, but mid-off throws himself to his right to take all the sheen off that shot. Good save from Santner
full and holds its line outside off, no shot offered
short and skiddy on off, Shakib thought about a pull, then shelved it, and simply fended it back to Boult
full and speared on middle, driven straight back to Boult
back of a length, no lateral movement outside off, angled out to point
back of a length and angled in on off, tapped to cover
length and outside off, plays with soft hands and guides the ball to gully
sloppy stuff at mid-off. Length and outside off, Shakib moves forward and punchily drives it, Williamson, I think, lets the ball through his legs for the first boundary of the day
back of a length and outside off, glided to point

The angle from around the wicket makes Mominul play. He had been leaving the ball judiciously on day one. Good length, angled in, then seamed away. Burst off the deck and opened 'em up slightly. Mominul has a skittish waft. Takes the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat and Watling snaffles it. Excellent delivery. Mominul fails to add to his overnight score
short and angled in, fended to leg
back of a length and outside off, flashes and sends an outside edge flying over the cordon
back of a length and angled in on off, jabbed back off the inside half
full and holds its line outside off, plays away from the body, and squirts an inside edge onto the pad
bouncer on off now, 135.7ks, ducks under it
short on leg, worked square through the leg side
picked off the pads through backward square leg
back of a length, angling away, seaming away, rears up. Hits the shoulder of the bat and lobs over gully
short on leg stump, tucks Mushfiq up for room. Fended back to the bowler
full and holds its line outside off, pushed to cover on the front foot
steered to point
half-tracker outside off, Shakib leaps and hammers a cut in the air over point
short, angled in, ducks under it
Southee errs in line and length again. Short and wide outside off, slapped in the air over point. Nobody there square on the off side and Shakib prospers again. Three fours in seven balls
full and angled in on off, blocked to mid-off
back of a length and angling across off, left alone
pretty full and outside off, Mushfiq flows forward, meets the pitch, and push-drives the ball between the bowler and short extra cover
back of a length and outside off, stands tall and punches to cover
bouncer, Shakib slips underneath the ball
another lifter on off, ducks under again
back of a length and outside off, Shakib's back-foot force finds backward point
full and on a fifth-stump line outside off, cross-seamer, Mushfiq gets forward, covers his off stump, and lets it go
full and outside off, good-looking front-foot drive to cover
clipped away to the right of midwicket
good length and angled in, gets forward and plays it back to Southee
back of a length and angled in, jabbed on the back foot towards point
full and holds its line outside off, creams a front-foot straight straight to Nicholls at extra cover
back of a length and angling away just outside off. Defended onto the pitch
similar length on off, blocked on the pitch again on the back foot
very full and angling away, wide enough for Mushfiq to leave
back of a length on middle, jumps off the surface, Mushfiq hops, skips, and fends to where forward short leg may have been. Mushfiq cops a blow on his finger. He need some medical attention.
good length and angled in, presses forward and dabs to the cover-point region
length and angled into a solid defence
full and just a shade outside off, Mushfiq is on the move as he aims a drive. Skews an inside edge that rolls down to mid-on
wide of the crease, angled in on off, pushed to covers
full on off, gets forward and drives it back to Southee
short and outside off, Mushfiq respects it and ducks under
short, angled in on middle, Mushfiq evades another lifter
pitched further up and outside off, Mushfiq brings out a drive and finds mid-off
starts off with a rising short ball on off, Shakib rises with it and fends it onto the pitch
back of a length and holds its line on off, dabbed with soft hands square through the off side
pitched up and slanting away outside off, Mushfiq shoulders arms
tight line on off, Mushfiq lets the ball slide off the face to gully
bouncer on leg stump, there is a forward short leg in place, Mushfiq ducks under this
short and angling away outside off, forces Mushfiq into ducking again
short and angled in on off, chopped to point
Southee goes wide of the crease, but this full ball holds its line outside off. Shakib takes it on the up and punches it in the gap at the covers. Holds his pose and then takes off for a couple
there's the  bouncer, this time from Southee. Angled in, Shakib gets under it, loses his balance, and tumbles on the floor
short and angled in on middle, Shakib holds his balance now and slips under it
full and angled in on off, gets forward and drives the ball to mid-off
short and holds its line outside off, leans back and cuts it firmly fine of backward point. 24 of Shakib's 31 have come via fours
back of a length, rears up on leg stump, jammed in front of short leg. Wagner hits the bat as opposed to the bat hitting ball
very full and swings back in the air, blocked back to the bowler
camps back for the short ball outside off, pulled away to the right of midwicket for a double
wide half-volley outside off, Mushfiq drills a drive. Sends the ball screaming through the covers
good length on middle, steps back and defends
shoulder-high short ball on the leg stump, Mushfiq wants to take it on with a hook. But is beaten by the extra bounce off the pitch
full and angled in on off, Shakib presses forward and pats it to cover
full and angled back in from around the wicket, Shakib plays across the line and manages an inside edge onto the pad. In any case, it was heading down leg with the angle
back of a length and outside off, Shakib chops hard onto the ground. The ball rolls away behind point
full on middle, played back to the bowler on the front foot
overpitched and outside off, bends forward and crunches a drive to sweeper
full and angled in from over the wicket, hits the pad of Mushfiq now, drifting down leg again
lifter on off, ducks under it
short and outside off, Shakib leaps for a cut. The ball hits the top of the bat and squirts it wide of gully. Raval dives to his left and stops the ball
short and skids on leg stump, chest-high delivery, tucks 'em up for room. Fended away past short leg
good length and angling away outside off, deflected off the face past gully. Bangladesh pass 200 with that four
back of a length and angling away outside off, nudged to point
pitched up and angling away outside off, gets forward and drives it straight of mid-off. The outfield isn't quick after the rain on day one
full and angled in on off, blocked to midwicket
full and straight, worked to midwicket
full and angled into a solid push back to the bowler
full and outside off, guided to cover
too full on off, moves forward and drives back to the bowler
puts it full on off again, pushed back to him on the front foot
shoulder-high lifter just outside off, ducks under it
short and angled in on off and middle, forces Shakib to duck under again
slams another one into the middle of the deck. Shakib gets under again
but the length does not chase. Short on leg and middle, Shakib ducks and takes shelter
the short-ball attack continues, climbs over the ducking batsman, climbs over the stumps
an over of short balls ends. Lifter outside leg, ducks under
full and on a fourth-stump line outside off, left alone
back of a length and outside off, punched to point. Latham dives to his left and stops the ball
full and angled in on off, jammed back to the bowler. Bangladesh have played 15 dots in a row, but they are unruffled
yorker on off, dug out to midwicket

Mushfiq loses his patience. Wide delivery, cross seamer, Mushfiq flashes a wild drive away from the body as the outside edge flies over a leaping second slip or rather just brushed the fingertips of Raval en route to the third man boundary. Very difficult chance for Raval
full and angled in on middle, blocked back to the bowler. And that's drinks

raps the glove! Sharp short ball on leg stump, Mushfiq loosens his grip, leaps, and somehow fends... to where short leg may have been
bouncer, ducks under safely now

It takes a moment of brilliance to end a double-century stand. BJ Watling behind the stumps produces that moment of brilliance for NZ. The umpires are checking for a possible no-ball. The front foot is fine, as is the back foot. Shakib keeps waiting. Oh wait, is that a clean catch? The on-field umpires refer it upstairs. The TV umpire Llong examines it, oh dear, Watling has grassed it. Hammered short on the leg stump from around the wicket, cramps 'em up for room. Shakib is caught in an awkward tangle as he takes Wagner on and pulls. The ball only lobs behind off Shakib's glove. Watling moves swiftly to his right and then pulls out a full-length dive to grasp the ball. He tries to squeeze the ball in with both gloves. But just as he lands on the turf, the ball pops out

full and angled into the pads, nudged to the right of the leg umpire. Turns the strike to Shakib
full and outside off, shimmies out and mis-hits a drive to mid-off
back of a length and around off, chopped to point

Shakib becomes the third Bangladeshi, after Mushfiq and Tamim, to hit a double-hundred in Test cricket. Short of a length and outside off, nails a square-cut. Removes his helmet and soaks in the applause. Pierced the gap with laser-guided precision. Mushfiqur, not Shakib, roars, and seems to have enjoyed the moment more
slower short ball down leg, Shakib pulls early and does not make contact
Shakib leaps and pulls a short ball down to long leg
short and outside off, fended back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, Shakib throws his hands at a cut. Swishes and toe-ends the ball to point
ripping inswinging yorker, dug out
short and wide outside off, slapped away to third man

Boult and NZ finally find a way past this record-breaking pair. Nicely pitched up, angling away from over the wicket, swings away outside off. Mushfiq is lured into driving away from the body and outside-edges it behind. Lazy shot. Straightforward catch for Watling. The fifth-wicket stand ends at 359
pitched up on middle, blocked back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, carved out to deep point. Gets to 206 and draws level with Tamim
full and angled in on off, played back to the bowler
short of a length and comes back in, hangs back and fends to leg
full and angled in, blocked to midwicket
left alone outside off
short of a length and outside off, scythed away to cover on the back foot
back of a length and comes in from outside off, leans back and chops to point
full on off, gets forward and drives it back to the bowler

very full on middle, push-drives to mid-off, and hares across to the other end. Shakib now owns the record for the highest individual score by a Bangladesh player in Test cricket. Tamim, who previously held the record, gives Shakib a standing ovation. Tamim is the first to applaud. Great scenes for Bangladesh
good length on off, defended
pitched up and outside off, pushed towards the off side
overpitched and outside off, driven off the middle of the bat but Santner throws himself to his left from short extra and stops the ball
full on middle, a booming drive through cover ensues. Shakib calls for two
full and outside off, driven on  the up to cover
back of a length and outside off, viciously flat-batted to mid-off
overpitched and outside off, belts a drive to mid-off, a misfield gifts the single Shakib was looking for
very full and angled in on middle, pushed down the ground to mid-on
wide of the crease, fires in a yorker on off, Sabbir jams it out to midwicket
short and wide outside off, punishes Wagner with another cracking square-cut
leg-stump full-toss, Shakib misses out. Just flaps it away square through the leg side
back of a length and swings away outside off, stands tall and punches crisply through the covers. Sabbir gets off the mark after 12 balls
full on off, defended back to the bowler
proper bouncer on middle, Sabbir sinks under it
full and wide outside off, Shakib misjudges the length. Flashes and does not make contact
wide delivery, crunched to sweeper cover
bouncer on leg stump, Sabbir is happy to duck under it
short on off, hip-high ball, swatted away behind square on leg
very full on the stumps, moves forward and drills a drive back to the bowler
full on off, aims a big drive and gets it off the inside half to midwidwicket
full and angling away outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, punched to deep point
full-toss on off, hacked to mid-on off the inside half

Shakib plays on for 217 - the highest individual score by a Bangladesh player in Tests. Good length ball on off - neither short nor wide for the cut - Shakib still attempts the shot. Tired shot. Chops onto the stumps via a thick inside edge. He is congratulated by the NZ players. What an innings. He perishes 10 minutes before stumps
bouncer on leg, ducks under it
full and angled down leg, past the flick
short and kicks up on off, hurries Sabbir for pace. Fended onto the pitch
short and angled in on off, fended behind square for two
full toss, swings in, driven to short midwicket
short ball outside off, Sabbir sways his upper body out of the way
full on middle, played back to the bowler
pitched up on middle, drives to mid-off
bouncer on leg stump, Wagner continues to run in hard and hit the deck harder at the stroke of stumps. The batsman ducks under it
full on middle, defended back to the bowler
lifter, angling away from off, ducks under
very full and angled in from around the wicket, driven down the ground, past the bowler's right, to mid-on
back of a length on off, jabbed back to the bowler
full on off, shows the full face of the bat and drives to mid-off
overpitched on off, Sabbir shuffles across off and connects with an on drive, places it to the left of a diving mid-on
bouncer, angled in, ducks under it
shortish and outside off, Sabbir arches his back and lets it pass to Watling
short and angled in on off, safely fended away to the leg side
back of a length and swerving away outside off, Miraz has a naught flirt and edges it. It does not carry to second slip
much fuller and on off, defended
wide of the crease, angled full on off, push-driven to cover on the front foot
bouncer, angled in, ducks under it safely
wide of the crease, this full ball holds its line outside off, driven to extra cover
pitched up and slanting away outside off, Miraz pushes away from the body and nicks it to Southee at second slip. Miraz gone for a 13-ball duck; gone off the last ball on day two
short and down leg, Sabbir slips under it
back of a length and holds its line outside off, punchily played to cover
fractionally short and outside off, cut away to deep point on the back foot. Sabbir hares back for the second
short ball on the leg stump, glanced away extremely fine past the diving keeper. Gloved away to the left of Watling
short on off, sways his upper body out of the way
lifter on off, sways away again
full and holds its line outside off from over the wicket, Taskin wafts away from the body and watches the ball pass the outside edge
short and angled in on off, leaps back and defends
bouncer, angled in, Taskin, batting out of the crease, sinks under it
full and angled in, squirted to long leg, for his first runs in Test cricket
bouncer, angled across off, sways away
Bangladesh reach 550. Chest-high short ball on middle and leg, carefully pulled to long leg
back of a length and outside off, leans back and late-cuts it fine of gully. No slips in at all
good length on off, gets forward and blocks it to cover
full and outside off, presses forward and drives to the left of extra cover for a couple
wide of the crease, angled in, played back to the bowler
banged in short, angled in, bursts off the deck. Sabbir judges it well, drops his gloves, and sways away from the line of harm again

Sabbir chances a quick single. Nicholls can't nail the stumps down from square leg. Back of a length and slanted in on middle and leg, worked more or less straight to Nicholls. A direct hit could have had Taskin
full and angling away outside off, slices a drive through backward point
short and angled in, fended back
hurled short on the hips, not short enough, tucked square of leg-gully

full and angling away outside off, from over the wicket, reaches out for a drive, reaches out with his hands and skews the ball to midwicket off an inside edge. The foot was nowhere close to the pitch
bouncer on leg stump from over the wicket, ducks under
can't pinch the strike, gets a boundary. Short ball on the leg stump, Sabbir can't control it. Top-edges a hook fine on the leg side
full on off, pushed to cover on the front foot
full and angled in just outside off, capably driven to mid-off
even fuller and angled in on middle, clipped through midwicket for one. Sabbir trusts Taskin
pushed to mid-on
jabbed to cover
full and angled in on off, hit to mid-on on the front foot
full and just a shade outside off, presses forward and drives back to the bowler
lifter, angled in, ducks and evades it
tucked to deep square leg. They decline the single on offer
left alone outside off
short and wide outside off, cut to backward point, who fumbles and allows two
pushed to point on the back foot
short and wide outside off, wild swish and a miss
full and outside off, driven crisply to mid-off

Dropped by Latham at mid-on. Short and holds its line outside off from around the wicket, Sabbir drags a pull in the air. Latham moves to his right, misjudges it and shells the chance. That should have been taken. Dolly
full and angled in, played back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, pushes with hard hands, plays away from the body and edges it behind. Southee snaffles this catch at second slip without any fuss
full on leg stump, defended square on leg side
banged short, hooked to deep square. Sabbir turns down the single
short and whizzes through outside off, evades it
full and angled in on a fourth-stump line, pushed to point
dug short and outside off, sways away
bouncer, angled in, ducks under
full on the stumps, defended
full and outside off. Opens the face and guides the ball to gully with soft hands
very full and just outside off, kept out
full and outside off, dabbed through the cover-point region
tight line just outside off, pokes and edges it, threading the cordon. Played with soft hands
blocked to point
bouncer, ducks under
waft and a miss outside off
full on off, defended to cover
overpitched and outside off. Bashes a drive to deep point for a double
back of a length and outside off, hangs back and jabs behind square on off
punched to point
short on off, sits up to be hit, pulled over midwicket
full on middle, dead-batted
left alone outside off
length ball on off defended to cover
lifter, angled in, ducks under
Full and angled across off from over the wicket now, left alone
Rabbi sees out the over. Near yorker on middle and leg, dug out
short and outside off, swish and a miss
full and angling away outside off, throws his bat at the ball. Still can't make contact
even wider outside off, left alone
overpitched and outside off, drilled down the ground. Long-on runs to his right, he is lazy to bend down, the ball rolls away to the boundary. Williamson makes a mess of it
lifter, angling away from off, ducks under it
pushed through on off, camps back and defends to leg
tossed up on off, dead-batted
arm-ball slides in, blocked on the back foot
stabbed out to cover
defended to cover
worked through the vacant spaces at midwicket. Sabbir moves to 49
full and angling away outside off, mis-times a drive to mid-off. Goes hard at the ball and loses his shape

Sabbir nails it through the covers. Even fuller and outside off, crunches a drive on the up and in the gap and raises his bat. He becomes the fifth Bangladesh player to make a fifty-plus score in this innings
left alone outside off
full and angled across off, no shot offered
full and outside off, glided with soft hands towards backward point. They take the single
left alone outside off
good length and angling away, no shot offered
bouncer, angling away. Latham is forced to duck under it
left alone outside off
edged and wide of lone slip. Tossed-up offbreak outside off, Miraz hung it up in the air, Raval reaches out for a drive and skews it just out of reach of diving first slip
flighted on off, angled in from around the wicket. Blocked to short leg
driven to the covers on the front foot as this was fairly full and outside off
floated up outside off, sliced in the gap between cover and point
looped up on middle, no turn, quietly played back to Miraz
back of a length and skirts away outside off, extra bounce. Latham did well not to follow the curve of the ball. Allowed himself to get beaten
full, pitches outside the leg stump, and grazes the pad. Latham weathers the lbw appeal
full and on leg stump from wide of the crease, Latham aims the leg side, ends up getting a leading edge to cover
full and angling away outside off, poked to point. Latham gets a single thanks to an overthrow
Roy snatches the outside edge. It escapes in the gap between gully and slips. Nice and full angling away just outside off, Raval's bat comes down at an awkward angle. He is opened up but gets away
full and angling away again, Raval now employs soft hands. The ball rolls off a glancing edge along the ground between slips and gully
rolls on full and outside off, Latham shoulders arms
tossed full on middle, the new ball skids on, the batsman thrusts his bat in front of the pad in defence
slides on outside off, no turn, left alone in the channel
pushed through on middle and leg, clipped away to wide mid-on
lobbed up outside off, left alone again
skids into the leg stump, turned into the vacant spaces at square leg on the back foot
full and angling across off, ends on a fourth-stump line, almost 140ks, the left-hander judges it well and lets it pass to Kayes
shorter and slanting across off, 137ks, no shot offered again
Roy ventures wide of the crease and gets this full one to angle across off, Raval does not bother with it again
back of a length and going away outside off, Raval can happily leave these
can't make him play again. Full and angled in on a fourth-stump line, excellent judgement from Raval
short and angled in on off, tucked away square through the leg side for a couple
full on middle and off, presses forward in defence
short and outside off, steps back and beautifully punches off the back foot through cover
slider outside off, the batsman watches it through to Kayes
veering into the pads, chipped on the bounce to short leg
full and outside off, he meets the pitch and blocks on the front foot
tossed up on off, check-pushed in front of the bowler
short of a length on middle, blocked back
half-volley on the pads, put away to the square leg fence with a flick. Easily done. No protection there
full on the pads again. Flicked away. Rabbi runs across from long leg, slides, and cuts it off to three
full tempter outside off. Latham isn't tempted
full and angling across off, played back to Roy on the front foot
wide of the crease, short and angling away wide outside off, the batsman drops his wrists on it
short and angled in, goes back and forces the ball through the midwicket region
tossed up, hint of turn, left alone
short and outside off, Latham plays at the last possible moment, cutting through square
keeps it short and outside off, this is punched to backward point on the back foot
nudged off the pads to square leg
goes back to handle a short ball. Serenely punched through cover. Miraz needs to work on his length
good length and angling away outside off from over the stumps, nothing doing from Raval
shot. Pitched up on off, not quite a half-volley, times a drive straight of mid-off
full and angling away just outside off, attempts a drive and skews it back to Taskin off the inside half. Raval went hard at the ball and lost his shape in the process

Dropped at third slip. Good length, angling away, shaping away outside off, bounces and squares up the batsman. He pokes feebly and the fielder puts down a low but fairly simple catch to his right. Sabbir, I think, is the culprit. Taskin has his hands on his head. Isam, from the ground, confirms Shakib is the culprit
full and angling away outside off, Raval shoulders arms
half-volley on the pads, driven neatly to the left of mid-on
turning down leg tickled fine past the keeper for two
goes low and sweeps to deep square
dropped short and outside off, punched through cover
short on middle and leg, steps back and punches to mid-on
good length and angling away outside off, covers his off stump and lets it pass
full and wide outside off, Latham won't go after these
much closer to off, but nor close enough to draw a stroke
short on off, Latham rises on his toes, fends to point and sets off. Bangladesh concede another off an overthrow
back of a length and angling away outside off, left alone
lifter, angling away outside off, the batsman gets under it
short and outside off, steps back and chops to cover
floated up - full and outside off - driven on the front foot to the right of mid-off
straight ball on middle, blocked back with a straight bat
dragged down outside off, Latham goes deep in the crease and handsomely punches through the cover-point region. Got on top of the ball and middled it
slides into the leg stump, defended to short leg
glanced around the corner. Brings up the fifty stand, solid start from NZ
back of a length and slanting away outside off, left alone
much fuller, but not close enough to make Latham play
and again. Wide outside off, Latham ushers it through to Kayes
lifter, angling away outside off, Latham arches his back and lets it pass over to Kayes again
back of a length and angling away from off, left alone again
short of a length and outside off, Latham plays and hits it to the right of point. Cut away with authority
full and outside off, push-driven to mid-off
slides on outside off, slightly short, steps back and punches straight to point
speared in on leg stump, pulled to backward square
dug short and outside off, goes back again, punching to cover
more round-arm than usual. Slung down leg, past the whip
tossed on middle, defended with a straight bat
short and angling across off from over the wicket, left alone. Taskin is not making the openers play enough
back of a length on middle, camps back and fends it back to the bowler
good length on off, Latham is on the move as he pushes the ball to mid-off and raises his bat to his partner saying 'no'
full and angling away just outside off, left alone
short and angling across off, Latham half-ducks and half-sways out of the way
and again. Sways away from a bouncer outside off

and he strikes with his first ball. Back of a length and largely holds its line outside off, rather than angling away, leaps off the surface. Raval attempts a cut - not a full-blooded shot - and top-edges it behind to Kayes, the part-time keeper. The opener's feet went nowhere. A boost for Bangladesh 10 minutes before lunch. Shakib would have relieved, having dropped Raval on 24
back of a length and angled in on off, crease-bound chop square on the off side
back of a length and angled in, turned to leg
left alone outside off
back of a length and speared outside off, Latham won't chase these
full on off, presses forward and push-driven to mid-off
overpitched and outside off, flows forward and drives to extra cover
back of a length and angled in on off stump, fended away to the right of the bowler
short and skiddy on off, hops and blocks back
dabbed to gully with soft hands
back of a length and on a sixth-stump line outside off, Williamson simply watches it through to Kayes
Williamson rises on top of a short ball outside off and punchily plays it to cover
nice and full, angling away outside off, Latham shoulders arms
another full tempter outside off, Latham isn't tempted
full and wide outside off, Latham is just as consistent in letting it go
wide outside off, left alone
he gets close enough to off now, but does not pose a threat to off, so Latham ignores again
short of a length and outside off, punched on the back foot to point
wrong line, on the hips, glanced easily to long leg
full on a sixth/seventh-stump line outside off, Williamson shoulders arms
short and thuds into the bat, Williamson stands up tall and punches to cover
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, jumps and punches the ball to the right of mid-off
good length on off. Latham blocks with a straight bat
short and outside off, Latham lifts his bat skyward and leaves
back of a length on off, serenely punched on the back foot, just to the right of a diving mid-off. Skips away to the fence
half-volley outside leg, Williamson tucks into it, literally, to the square leg fence. Flicked to the left of the leg umpire

Williamson takes a hat-trick of boundaries? No, this is cut off in the deep. Short of a length and outside off, the NZ captain goes deep in the crease and punches again, this time to the left of a diving backward point
make that three boundaries in four balls. Short of a length and outside off, very short. Williamson cuts hard between gully and point
short of a length and outside off, leans back, holds the elbow up and regally punches through cover. Just a single, though
full around off, moves forward and knocks the ball defensively to cover
and again, Williamson has been brilliant with his back-foot punches. And Bangladesh are feeding his strength. He stays side-on, rides the bounce, and hits through cover
back of a length on middle and leg, clipped down towards long leg
full and on a fifth-stump line outside off, Williamson exercises caution and shoulders arms
back of a length and outside off, chopped onto the ground, gully jumps and collects the ball
proper bouncer outside off, Williamson knows the fielder is now back. Shelves the hook and lets it pass over him

just short of a good length and outside off, Williamson leaps off his feet and gorgeously punches it this time much squarer through the off side. Freeze the moment in which he goes airborne and punches... simply beautiful
full and angling across off, Latham does not bother with it
wide half-volley, left alone outside off
shorter on a fifth-stump line, Latham's judgement in the channel has been good. Left alone
full on middle, gets forward and plays an economical push straight down the ground
short on off, swivels back, rolls his wrists and controls a pull to deep square leg. You've got to get the ball to bounce higher to bring deep square into play
full on off, presses forward and taps to cover
full on off, blocked back to the bowler
pitched up just outside off, sliced drive to cover
full and outside off, plays with soft hands, steers to second slip, who had been added before this ball
back of a length on off, dabbed to gully now with an angled bat
back of a length and just outside off, chopped into the ground, bounces over to gully
lifter on off, Williamson has his eyes locked on the ball before ducking under it. Decent over - maiden - from Roy
full and outside off, moves forward, meets the pitch, and drives the ball on the up to extra cover
back of a length and outside off, Latham drives again to cover
full and just outside off, shelves the drive and leaves now
goes back to driving again, but this is mis-hit off the front foot straight to cover. Good follow-up over so far from Rabbi
follows a brace of full balls with s surprise short ball on leg stump, aimed at the helmet. Latham pulls and gloves it fine to the right of the keeper
full and outside off, has a skittish push playing back. That short ball pushed him back. The outside edge streaks away through the cordon
pretty full on off, flows forward and drives down the ground, can't beat short midwicket moving to his left

short ball on off, zips off the surface, catches Williamson in a tangle. Rises at the chest. The NZ captain was caught between hooking and leaving. He does a bit of this, a bit of that, and fends it to leg. The pitch seems to have quickened up?
full and slanting away outside off, left alone
full and angling across off again. Latham's patience does not waver. Left alone
clipped off the pads straight to square leg
lifter on the leg stump, ducks under it
back of a length, jumps and skids through outside off, bounces over the attempted cut
back of a length and outside off, leaps on top of the bounce, and punches through cover
short and wide outside off. Cut to deep point
full and angling across off, Latham leaves it be

rare false stroke from Latham. Nearly played on. Good length and outside off, yes the pitch has quickened up. Skids on off. The batsman looks to force through the off side. He is late to bring his bat down, inside-edged onto the pad
full on middle and leg, Latham falls over as he misses the flick. Slipping down the leg side
bouncer on leg, Latham hunkers down
Nearly plays on, again Short and outside off, hustles the batsman for pace. Pulls and bottom-edges it past the leg stump
chest-high short ball on middle, Latham brings out a well-controlled pull to long leg
good length and outside off, deftly steered to deep point
full and just outside off push-driven to mid-off on the front foot
short and outside off, pulled to midwicket
full and just a shade outside off, Williamson watches it through to the keeper
135.4ks but zipped through like a much quicker one. Good length, jumps off the surface, and pings the glove of Williamson as he aims to fend
low full-toss on off, errs in length and is punished. Driven down the ground, straight of mid-on. Classy
wide half-volley, ignored
short and wide outside off, Williamson lets another one go
clipped off the pads to the right of long leg. Brings up the fifty stand
back of a length on middle, secures a single with a back-foot punch to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, kicks up off the surface, left alone
full and outside off, opens the face and drives to the left of extra cover
back of a length on the stumps, blocked back down the pitch
short and outside off, not short enough to trouble Latham. Rocks back and pulls it to the right of long leg
full-toss on middle, bunted down to long-on
looped up on middle from around the stumps, dead-batted
hurled short into the pads, popped to the left of short leg
tossed full on middle, solidly driven back to the bowler
flighted on middle, non-turning offbreak, blocked to the right of short leg now
tossed and outside off, smothered on the front foot. That's drinks. 111 for 1. Nice symmetry
back of length on off, whipped with the wrists to the right of midwicket
full on middle, driven on the front foot past mid-off's right
just short of a good length and outside off, Williamson plays late, dabbing down to gully
back of a length and outside off, Williamson late-cuts in the air but to the left of gully
fuller on off, tip-and-run single in front of square on the off side
bouncer on off or just outside off, ducks under it
flatter and outside off, punched down the ground to the right of a diving Miraz
leans back and punches a short ball from outside off to deepish point
flatter and outside off, whipped away through midwicket on the back foot. Williamson looks for the second but his partner sends him back
now it's Latham's turn to whip to deep midwicket. Brings up a very solid fifty
Williamson moves to 49 with a top-quality shot. Uses his feet, meets the pitch, and chips it over midwicket
back of a length and outside off, left alone
tucked off to midwicket on the back foot
fullish on off, defended
wide of the crease, but this full ball holds its line outside off, pushed to mid-off on the front foot
what a fluent fifty from Williamson. Off just 54 balls. Full and angled down leg, tickled fine past the diving keeper

how about that for a first Test wicket? Full, angled in, and straightens away, off the seam, slightly outside off. Williamson dangles his bat out and gets a thin edge behind to Kayes. Waist-high catch. First real false shot from the NZ captain. Fifty and out
shortish on off, back-foot punch down to long-on
keeps it short and outside off, steps back and cuts merrily through cover
flighted and angled in, thrusts his bat in front of the pad in defence
short and outside off, chopped out to deep point
arm ball, darted in on middle, blocked
much slower through the air, blocked with a straight bat
back of a length on middle, defended back
good length on middle, defended
short and outside off, guided to gully
pushed straight to deepish point. Latham is eager for a single, Taylor isn't
short and outside off, 129.4ks, but seems to have hurried off the pitch. Bottom-edged on the unprotected area on the thigh
short and outside off, stands up tall and sweetly punches, sending it skipping over the practice pitches to the cover-point boundary
round-armed into the pads. Defended
uses his feet, drives to mid-off and gets off the mark
nudged off the pads to deep midwicket
loopier on off, defended
too full on middle, races down the track and drives it firmly straight of mid-on. He's seeing it well alright
tossed on off, defended to cover
full and outside off, holds its line, sliced to cover
full, angling in, drives loosely and inside-edges it behind square
overpitched and outside off, gets forward, meets the pitch, and creams a cover drive. Placed to the left of extra cover
another wide half-volley, Taylor melts out the same treatment. Laces another drive through the covers. Easy on the eye. 13 off nine balls
Make that 17 off 10 balls. Full and angled in, driveable length. Taylor is late onto the ball, an inside edge streaks away past the leg stump
back of a length on off, worked to midwicket
Taylor jumps down the track, he is beaten in the air, but adjusts and whips it away past mid-on's right. Taylor is on fire in Wellington
full on off, pushed back to the bowler
swept to backward square
defended to short leg
Taylor comes down the track, again, this time he's closer to the pitch. Delightfully flicked to the right of mid-on. Six fours in 16 balls. I'd have to say Taylor has got his eye in
shimmies out and secures a single to long-on, who had been whisked back after the previous four
short on off, angled in, defended
full and outside off, cracked to sweeper
short and angled in from around the wicket, hangs back and nurdles a single behind square
big bouncer on off, sails over the keeper, after Taylor bailed out of the hook. Five Wides
hip-high short ball outside off, swatted to midwicket. Taylor isn't in the mood to back down
full and just a shade outside off, blocked back
wide of the crease, angled in, he has been imperious on the front foot, driven away to the right of mid-on
back of a length and outside off, stands tall and punches square through the off side. That's Latham's most productive area
full on off, defended back to the bowler
full around off, knocked to cover on the front foot
short and hits the bat hard. Fended to off
very full and angling away outside off, left alone
worked off the pads to midwicket
straying into the pads, neatly clipped to the right of long leg
back of a length on off, hangs back and blocks to midwicket
full on off, defended on the front foot
bouncer, on middle, ducks under it with two men in the deep

'

pretty full from around the wicket, attempts a sweep, gets hit on the pad, and tumbles on the floor. Umpire Reiffel shakes his head. Impact is outside the line of off, I suppose. Could have gone onto hit off, but the impact is marginally outside off, and the on-field call stays
full and outside off, drills a drive, silly-point is in the way. Cops what seems like a painful blow on the leg

short and outside off, gets up on his toes and steers it deftly between slips and gully. Enters the 90s
short and angling away outside off. Latham evades it

full and outside off, crouches and leaves it in the channel
bad ball down the leg side, this shot is even worse. Nicholls flicks and skies a leading edge. It drops in front of Tamim running in from short cover. Tamim, perhaps, was late to pick up the ball
tossed on off, driven back down the pitch
stabbed back to Miraz
errs short and wide, slapped away square on off
leans back and punches another short one to deep point. Fourth fifty stand of the innings
straying into the hips, clipped away square through the leg side. Comes back for the third and raises his sixth Test hundred
left alone outside off
tight line on off, pushed to mid-off
short, angling away, sways away from the line

ooh, how did that miss off stump?. Nicholls is almost sleepily comes forward, offering a gigantic gap between bat and pad. smoothly moves back and flicks through square leg
pushes it through down leg, Nicholls tries a flick and fails to connect
leans forward to a flighted delivery on leg stump to block
drifts into the pads, Nicholls tries to work it away but the contact is with the body again

quick, shortish and outside off, steered through to the sweeper

on the pads and he works it away to the long leg boundary. Very little effort for a boundary. Mehedi hasn't been accurate enough here. Possibly discomfitted by the breeze
skips past the outside edge. This is a flatter delivery, just outside off, Latham goes to cut and plays under the ball
tosses it up on middle, drives to mid-on
slides it down leg again and Latham is bent over his bat, cursing himself for not getting a little bat to find the boundary behind him with the breeze
