full and angling across off stump, Santner watchfully shoulders arms

sharp lifter from Taskin, hits the badge of Santner's helmet. Two men in the deep for the hook. So he shelves the shot. He takes his eyes off the ball and instead ducks late. The ball strikes him flush on the helmet and rolls wide of gully
full on a fifth-stump line outside off, Watling lets it pass
another bouncer, thuds into the gloves of Kayes, and pops out. Left alone
short on middle, Santner is right behind the line in defence
full and drifts in on middle, Watling lunges forward and smothers it
pulls his length back on off, Watling reads it, skips back and punches back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, duly cut away through square. Watling stumbles at the non-striker's end, and has to settle with one
full on middle, belted back to the bowler, who sticks his left hand out and takes some pace off the ball
uses his feet, is beaten in the air, but turns the ball to leg
full and angled in, defended with the head right over the ball
Taskin tests Santner with another bouncer, leg-stump line, ducks under it
yorker on off, dug out
short on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
glanced to backward short leg
full on the stumps, pushed straight of mid-on for three
full and angling into a solid block back to the bowler
full on off, presses forward and plays it back to the bowler
short on middle, backs away and forces a single to mid-off
short and no turn outside off, goes back and slaps it away to sweeper
tossed on off, gets forward and blocks it back to the bowler
pitched up straight, defended
straight ball outside off, poked out to slip with soft hands
rank half-tracker outside off, Watling jumps, thumps a square cut and banishes the ball to the boundary
good length on middle, defended
full and angling in on off, presses forward and drives the ball to the left of short midwicket
short and outside off, chest-high take for Kayes as the batsman sways his upper body out of the way
nearly played on. Full and angled in, drives with a closed face and inside-edges it onto the back pad. Nearly spins back onto the stumps
overpitched on the stumps, Watling unfurls a sublime on-drive. Shot of the day so far
begins with a skiddy, chest-high short ball on middle, Santner throws his bat up like a face-shield
another lifter, angling away outside off, Bangladesh looking to rattle Santner with the short stuff. He arches back and it jumps just over the glove. Kayes leaps and collects the ball
three short balls in a row, sways and evades this too
short and angled in, Santner is wary of the threat and ducks under
short and thuds into the top of the bat. Guided to cover-point
the short-ball attack continues. Banged in on leg stump, over the wicket, fended off the glove wide of leg gully
half-tracker outside off, Watling climbs onto it. Thrashing a cut to the left of deep backward point
very full on off, Watling is on the move as he squeezes the ball back to Taskin
good length and angling in on off, blocked to cover with a straight bat
'no' is the cry from Watling as he defends a back of a length ball straight to cover
whipped off the toes to midwicket
dug short on middle, Santner steps away and guides it past gully's left
fuller to Watling, flicks the pad and Kayes grabs it down leg. No bat involved. Shakib was interested at cover, but Bangladesh decide against a review
whipped away to the right of the square leg umpire for a double
full on off, tip-and-run single to midwicket
full and wide - wider than a set of stumps outside off -  Santner stays back to a full ball and toe-ends it in the air.... does not carry to deep point
full and angling into leg stump, deflected to square leg
keeps it short on middle, pushes Santner back. Fended back to Taskin
dug down leg side, Santner holds his bat up and leaves it alone
short of a length and outside off, crunched to cover on the back foot. Punched straight to the fielder, Tamim gets a bad bounce and is hit on the chin
back of a length, falls over the flick, and takes it on the thigh
short and outside off, jumps and punches to the right of cover, can't beat Tamim
rip-roaring bouncer, angled in on middle from around the stumps, Santner handles it well enough, yanking his head out of the way
back of a length and angled in on off, played back to the bowler
wide of the crease and angled into a push back to the bowler
back of a length, kicks up and strikes the glove as Watling looks to defend
too straight and full, flicked to square leg
short on off, fended to leg
stands up tall and crisply punches a short ball to the right of sweeper
tight line and length, played back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, turns away further, goes back and cuts it away to the right of backward point
chopped from off stump between cover and point
length-ball offbreak, spins in, worked with the spin to midwicket
this slides outside off, Watling skips back and negotiates it
length ball, dabbed with the spin to midwicket
short and wide outside off, upper cut over gully. No third man to cut it off, and point is squarer
glanced off the hips to square leg
straying onto the hips again, turned to square leg
full and outside off, pushed to cover on the front foot
hip-high short ball on off, Santner camps back and swats it away to the left of square leg
short of a length on middle, gets behind the line and blocks
pushed through on middle, firmly sweeps over backward square
tossed on off, played back
fuller on off, defended on the front foot
slides on off, blocked
shuffles across and clips to the right of midwicket
paddled down to long leg

big appeal from Kayes behind the stumps. Not given. Bangladesh challenge the on-field call. Horrid short offbreak put a long way down the leg side. Watling shapes to swat it away. He does not get enough bat on ball. Kayes anticipates, runs swiftly to his left and clasps a brilliant catch. Hotspot detects a tiny blotch, and Mahmudullah strikes with his first ball to send Watling back. One of the worst balls in the match fetches a wicket
turning offbreak, whipped on the back foot through midwicket
short and wide outside off, hit to long-off
Southee has been given out lbw now. He reviews. Arm-ball, slides in, Southee plays inside the line and is rapped on the back pad. All three reds and what a double-strike from Mahmudullah
full on middle, defended
tight line on off, defended back
full on middle, played back again
worked down the pitch
tossed on off, kept out
nudged wide of short leg
tossed on off, run away to point
flighted on middle, defended
leans back and punches to the right of cover
flighted on middle, defended to mid-on
full and just a shade outside off, smothered on the front foot

Wagner comes down the track, the ball dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. Beats the inside edge, grazes the front pad and pops up to slip, who takes it. The zoomer confirms no bat involved. Umpire Reiffel's on-field not-out call is upheld, and Bangladesh lose a review
glanced behind square on the leg side
short of a length on middle, defended back to the bowler
short and angling away outside off, hits the shoulder and rolls to gully

Rabbi gives Wagner a dose of his own medicine. Dug in short, mean bouncer, Wagner cops a blow on the back of the helmet as he takes his eyes off the ball and half-ducks. The ball plonks behind to long leg
short and angling away outside off, Santner jabs at it and edges it; just drops in front of second slip
full and slanting away outside off, Santner hangs back instead of moving forward. Slices a drive square on off. Point is at the deep
back of a length and angling away, poked into the covers
whipped off the pads through square leg
tossed up outside off, Santner races down the track and smites it over long-on
tossed up on middle, defended
uses his feet, beaten in flight, dragged to long-on
sliding into the pads, worked behind square
back of a length on middle, Wagner gets behind the line in defence
shot. Short of a length and angling away outside off, stands tall, holds his elbow up and punches through wide mid-off
short on middle, slides off the face to point
back of a length on middle, camps back and blocks to cover
bouncer, angling away outside off, Wagner half-ducks and half-sways out of the way
much fuller and angling across off, Watling watches it through to the keeper
fullish on middle and leg, clips it to midwicket and acknowledges his fifty. He has weathered a blow to his helmet, and several short balls. Well played
just short of a good length, instead of a pulling it away Wagner looks away and cops a blow on his body
hip-high short ball outside off, Wagner pulls it fiercely over wide mid-on
banged short on the leg stump, takes it on with another fierce hook. Pummels it over square leg. Hauls the hosts past 500
short and outside off, pulled away firmly to deep midwicket, along the ground
yorker outside off, sliced away to cover
just short of a good length on off, defended back to Rabbi

Wagner is struck on the helmet, again. He has a cut under the chin and is bleeding. Throat-hunting short ball, beats the hook, pings the grille in front of the chin. Good to see Wagner smiling, though. The impact actually forced the grille back and hurt the chin. He gets some medical attention

and Wagner is smacked on the helmet again. Rabbi hits the back of the helmet now. Hurled into the middle of the deck, bounces, hustles him for pace. Late onto the hook and cops another nasty blow. The bouncer and Wagner are not too far apart whether he is bowling or batting
good length on middle, gets behind the line in defence and gets a round of applause from the crowd

Rabbi bounces out Wagner. Deserves the wicket. Dug in short and outside and angling away off, Wagner is hurried into the hook. Skies a top-edge and Kayes settles under it. His fifth catch - the most by a sub keeper in an innings
bouncer on middle, ducks under
full and outside off, left alone
yorker, swerves in on middle and leg, dug out
follows the yorker with a short ball outside off, Boult sways his upper body out of the way
short and outside off, beats the ramp
full and and angled in on off, shuffles across off and defend solidly

whoa! Skips away to the boundary like a pebble on water. Was that Williamson or Boult? Full on middle, Boult eases forward and plays an economical push-drive straight of mid-on. Holds the pose like a boss
bouncer on leg, sails over the ducking batsman to the keeper
short on middle, backs away and flat-bats it out towards point
bouncer outside off, sways away carefully
fullish and holds its line outside off, angles out a defence to gully
full and on a set of stumps outside off, shuffles across and holds his bat up. Gee, his leaves are stylish too
back of a length and outside off, jabs away from his body and hits the ball to point
short of a length and outside off, backs away and laces a cut through the covers
Santner shows his ace rather early. Slinks away outside leg. This is a bumper following him. The batsman ducks and the ball beats Kayes moving to his right
short of a length on middle, shuffles around in the crease, and slugs it away disdainfully wide of mid-on
Santner moves outside the leg stump, the bowler errs very full and down leg, beats the glance. Beats the keeper. More byes
back of a length on leg stump, Santner, having shuffled across off, misses the glance
full toss on middle, pumped straight over the bowler's head. Long-off slides to his right and hauls the ball inside the boundary
hangs back to a full ball on leg stump and blocks to midwicket
nicely tossed up on middle, drifts in a bit, Boult is equal to the task. Defended
Boult now prods an inside edge to short leg
wide enough outside off to let it go
dug into the middle of the track, fended
short and outside leg as Boult backs away. He swings for the hills and banishes the ball to the midwicket boundary. Front-foot no-ball, but it isn't called
back of a length on middle, moves away outside leg and chops hard to backward point
shortish and angling away outside off, Santner clears his front leg. Has a wild swish and does not make contact
late-cuts to point and hares across to the other end
pitched up and outside off, gets forward and stylishly drives to mid-off. #thebestNo.11
tossed on middle, defended back with a straight bat
turning into leg stump, hangs back and pushes the ball to midwicket
straight ball, tapped back to the bowler
too full on off, flat-bats a drive to long-off
tossed on off, angles out a defence square on off
shuffles across off and blocks to short leg on the bounce
good length ball from around the wicket, glides it to third man with an open face
steers a wide yorker to gully and then checks the bottom of the bat
good length ball on off stump, defends
looks for another yorker, but it ends up a full toss. Pushes to mid-on
confidently clips a length ball to short midwicket
back of a length and outside off, beautifully left by Boult. Walks across to his partner with a big grin on his face. #No.11Diaries
flighted outside off from over the wicket, Santner drives to long-off and refuses the single
pushes to long-off and doesn't bother with the single again
flatter delivery outside off, Santner backs away and cuts to short cover
races down the track and hammers a flighted ball on off stump over the midwicket boundary. Hitting into the breeze, but there is plenty of power behind it. That's his top score in Tests
now he takes the single, moving back to punch a short delivery to long-off
flighted delivery on off stump, from over the wicket to the right-hander, defends
backs away and tries to ram a bouncer on middle and leg stump over the wicketkeeper. Doesn't connect

goes to pull, but the length is not there. The ball pitches fuller than Santner believes it is and skids under his bat to clatter into leg stump. He runs off, eventually coming to terms with his disappointment by jamming taking a swipe at the turf with his bat
nice and full, hint of inswing, Tamim falls over a flick and squirts a leading edge in front of cover
back of a length and angled in, Tamim drops the ball in front of cover, searches for a quick single; it isn't there
shorter and wider outside off, Tamim answers with a back-foot force, which scurries away to the right of point
back of a length and wide outside off, left alone
short and close to off, cramps Tamim up for room. He attempts a cut and ends up chopping the ball a few feet to his right on the off side
back of a length and angled across off, cracked on the back foot to point
short of a length on middle Kayes gets right behind the line and plays it back to the bowler
much fuller and swings in on middle and leg, blunted to midwicket
very full and angling away wide outside off, no shot offered
bouncer on middle, stump Kayes watches it well, then ducks under
but this is a full ball on off, and Kayes reads it well. Presses forward and bunts to cover
angled into the hips, clipped away easily to long leg
good length and holds its line outside off, Kayes covers his off stump and holds his bat up
wide outside off again although the length is good, easy leave
beaten on the outside edge. Nice and full, angled in, and swings away. Kayes simply hung his bat out and missed it
pitched up and holds its line outside off, opens the face and neatly runs it away to the right of point
half-volley on the pads, 142.1ks, duly clipped away through midwicket on the front foot
good length and angling away around off, Kayes inches forward and blocks it back to Southee
dishes out a short ball, angling away outside off, Kayes arches back and lets it pass over to Watling
full and holds its line outside off, moves forward, meets the pitch and steers it to cover
good length and angling into a solid defence
short and slanted down leg, the batsman glances but this is too wide down leg
crunchhhhhhhed away. Overpitched and outside off, Kayes leans forward and drives it to the right of extra cover
full and angled into the pads, nudged away to the left of the leg umpire
good length and outside off, Tamim drives a fair way away from the body and swishes to cover
tight line on off stump, Tamim is forward to deal with this full one
bouncer just outside off, rocks his head out of the way
pitched up and holds its line on fourth stump, Tamim shoulders arms
short and angled in at the body, Kayes hops and fends square on the leg side
full and angling into off - the right line and length - Tamim presses forward in defence. Southee has a aim at the stumps and hits Tamim on the backside. The batsman isn't pleased
bouncer outside off, Tamim gets under and evades it
half-volley outside off, Tamim brings out a majestic drive, but finds the man at extra cover
dug short on leg stump, Tamim swats it on the back foot to long leg
keeps it short and outside off, not short enough to trouble Kayes. He picked the length early, rocking back and pulling it over square leg for a six
full and angled in on off, no lateral movement, confidently pushed on the front foot to mid-on
picked off the pads to the square leg fence. Sweet timing. Too full from Boult
good length on off, Tamim stretches forward, jabbing drive back to Boult
short ball outside off, 138.5ks, leaps off the deck. Tamim is late on the hook. He attempted it although there was a man in the deep. Beaten in the end
nice and full on middle, Tamim knows there is no mid-on, and pushes through that vacant area
short and wide outside off, Kayes drops his wrists on it
tossed up liberally on off, defended back
gets forward and pushes to midwicket
turning into the pads , flicked away behind square on the back foot
straight ball on middle, calmly blocked back to Santner
driven from outside off to long-on on the front foot
full on off, Tamim moves forward and pushes it back to Santner
starts off with a ripping bouncer(what else?) on off, Kayes sinks under it
another lifter, forces Kayes into ducking again. Wagner throws a stare at Kayes
short on leg stump, rides the bounce, and tucks towards long leg
back of a length on the hips from around the wicket, clipped away behind square

short and angling away, ducks under. Third bouncer of the over - no-ball, and he gets a warning from the umpire. He is keen to give it back after being hit on the helmet a few times earlier in the day
full on middle, inches forward and plays it back
pitched up and outside off, driven to mid-off
flighted on the pads, worked through midwicket
turn and bounce for Santner, starts outside off and spins in. Inside-edged onto the thigh
flatter and turns in, blocked to leg
goes low, sweeps a straight ball from the stumps to long leg
looped up on middle, defended
back of a length, pitches just outside off and turns in. Tamim negotiates in on the back foot
Wagner runs in hard, hits the deck harder, finds big bounce from a length. Hops and fends it away through vacant gully. Kayes was caught in an awkward tangle
proper bouncer on the leg stump, ducks under it
short on off, Tamim hangs back and works it away towards midwicket
Tamim rises with this short ball outside off and diffuses it in front of cover
short ball on the leg stump, Tamim rides the bounce and guides it to the right of leg-gully
short and outside off, Kayes now rides it out to third man. Well played
short and spins back in on middle, Kayes rocks back and punches it to Santner
slides on middle, blocked to cover point
starts just outside off and turns in to take the thigh pad as Kayes holds his bat up and leaves
short on off, goes back and punches the ball wide of short leg
nudged square on the leg side
straight ball on off, Kayes plays for the turn and wafts it square on off
short ball outside off, Tamim drags his bat inside the line and drops his wrists on it
short and angled in, very close to the off stump, sails over the shoulder as Tamim arches his back and lets it go
bouncer outside off, Tamim drops his wrists again
just short of a good length on leg stump, Tamim goes deep in the crease and fends the ball towards midwicket
rides the bounce of this short one outside off and secures a single to point. Kayes dishes out a full-length dive and makes it. The fielder (Santner) can't throw the stumps down
short and outside off, Mominul holds his bat up and leaves it
tossed on the leg stump, defended in front of short leg

reverse-swept from off stump through point. Where did that come from? Santner chases hard, slides at the edge of the boundary, might have been in contact with the ropes while sliding. Doesn't matter. It's an all-run four
tossed on leg, defended

Santner disturbs the off bail. Good length ball, starts outside off and spins back in out of the footmarks.  Tamim misjudges the length. Goes back and attempts a late-cut. A front-foot push to cover would have been the ideal shot to that. The ball beats him and hits the top of the stumps. Bowled'em
liberally tossed outside off, driven off the inside half to the left of the bowler
Wagner greets Mahmudullah with a lifter on leg stump, fended to the right of short leg
short on off, flapped away square on the leg side
hip-high short ball on leg stump from around the wicket, it would have been a good length ball to another batsman. Pulls behind square and secures a double
short on middle and leg, fended to leg
dug down the leg side, shuffles inside the line and leaves
flighted full on middle from around the stumps, dead-batted
short and turns away, goes back and punches out to cover
slower and angled in on off, defended to the left of short leg
arm-ball, whipped on the back foot past midwicket's right
flighted on off, quietly kept out
looped up and outside off, eased down the ground to the right of a diving Santner. Beats mid-off to his left. Excellent timing
lifter on leg stump, Wagner continues to pepper Bangladesh with short balls. Ducks under
short and outside off, drops his wrists on it

Wagner has reward for the short-ball attack. Mahmudullah walks off, caught down the leg side. Bad news for Bangladesh. He shuffles across the stumps, this is short and down the leg side. Attempts a leg-glance, can't get enough bat on it. Tickles it behind to Watling. Careless high-five from Wagner, nearly pokes Watling's right eye
pitched up and angling away outside off, left alone
bouncer on leg, flies off the surface ducks under it
tossed on leg stump, blocked to short leg
slides in on off, plays inside the line and wafts to cover
back of a length and spins away wide outside off, slashes loosely and watches the ball bounce past the edge
full and outside off, some turn again, driven to mid-off
tight line on off, defended
arm-ball rips in with extra bounce, 96ks, negotiated on the back foot
back of a length and on a set of stumps outside off, ignored
length ball on off, works a single to wide mid-on

brilliant work from Santner. Spears a direct hit at the non-striker's end to catch the nightwatchman - Mehedi - short. Santner runs back and across to his left from mid-on, slides, releases the ball quickly and nails the stumps with pinpoint accuracy. Full and holds its line outside off from around the wicket, Mehedi does not meet the pitch and drives straight of mid-on. There is a mix-up between the wickets, Miraz looks for the second, he is late to undo his steps, and that is that on day four. What a frenetic last half hour!
good length and holds its line outside off, beats the outside edge
much fuller outside off, driven to cover
dug short and down the leg side. Mominul lifts his bat skyward and shuffles inside the line
tossed up on off, no turn, defended to the off side on the front foot
full and outside off, driven to mid-on on the front foot
turning down leg, left alone
straight ball on middle and leg, pushed to the left of the bowler

What was that, Shakib? Careless shot, very careless. Mid-on is inside the circle and the batsman just scoops up a simple catch to that fielder. He falls for a five-ball duck after a record 217 in the first dig. Tossed up much higher and spins in after starting outside off. Shakib attempts to swing hard, loses his shape in the process, and makes a royal mess of it. Easy catch for Williamson
full and holds its line on off, defended on the front foot
full and just a shade outside off, an unfazed Mominul flicks it away to the left of midwicket
quick bouncer outside off with extra shoulder. Mominul has his eyes locked on the ball before slipping underneath
short and outside off, forces the batsman to duck under it again
short and wide outside off, leaps and scythes it over a leaping backward point. Hit in the air but well over the fielder
second bouncer of the over, Mominul gets under
short and aimed at the throat, ducks under again
pitched up and outside off, Sabbir gets forward, meets the pitch, and drives to the left of extra cover
drifts in on off stump, blocked back on the front foot
change-up. Much quicker and flatter, darts in, defended on the back foot
tossed up, hint of turn, Santner snatches the outside edge. Rolls towards point
Santner finds turn off the pitch again. Sabbir has a crease-bound waft and edges it to the right of a diving slip. Gripped in the surface and encouraged Santner to toss it up higher
half-volley outside off, Sabbir punishes it. Driven hard through the covers
short on middle, fended
short and down leg, pulled away fine of Boult at fine leg
shorter and angling away outside off, Mominul ducks under it
short and outside off, more ducking from Mominul
back of a length and angled in, hits the top of the bat. Punched back down the pitch
back of a length and outside off, back-foot punch to cover
drifts in, prodded to the left of short leg off an inside edge
good length on off, Sabbir is right behind the line in defence
pitched up and outside off, driven to mid-off
straight ball on middle, blocked
full on off, played to cover
good length and angled in, blocked to short leg
full and outside off, opens the face and glides it square through the off side

full on middle and leg, driven through mid-on. Sabbir wants three, Mominul isn't interested. Watling screams 'keeper, keeper, keeper'. But De Grandhomme throws it to the bowler's end, where Sabbir makes it in the end. Bangladesh get away with this mix-up
short, ducks under it
short on off, blunted to cover on the back foot
back of a length and outside off, shuffles across and whips to midwicket
short and down leg, Mominul sways inside the line and lets it go
hangs it up in the air outside off, eased to mid-off. Driven crisply but straight to the fielder
back of a length and outside off, punched to cover on the back foot

flies away to the left of Taylor. Too difficult to call it a drop. Short and quicker outside off, steps back and edges a cut. The outside edge flies away to slip's wrong side. Taylor can't even get a hand to it
flatter and angling into a back-foot defence with the head over the ball
pitched up and outside off, drives on the up, ends up scooping the ball in the air to the right of extra cover
full and wider outside off, drives away from the body and misses
full and outside off, left alone now

Mominul has been uncertain with the drive throughout this over. That's because Wagner had pushed him back with the short stuff. Mominul now nicks it to de Grandhomme at gully. Full and wide outside off, Mominul is nowhere close to the pitch. Drives away from the body and this outside edge flies to hand. Bangladesh are effectively six down with Kayes not available to bat
short ball, tucks him up for room first up, Mushfiq loosens his grip, avoid further injury to his finger. Splices off the handle fine of leg gully now
short on leg, fended fairly straight to leg gully now
pitched up on off, defended with a straight bat
hint of turn outside off, left alone
full on off, smothered on the front foot
good length, drifts in on off, blocked
flicked to square leg
banged in short on middle, Mushfiq looks away, takes his eyes off the ball and somehow hooks it to the right of short leg
back of a length and angling across off, left alone. Watling was venturing down leg before going in line with the stumps
more short stuff, pings the glove, nearly lobs to short leg
bouncer outside off, ducks under it
flighted outside off, driven to mid-off on the front foot
turns away outside off, dabbed to cover with soft hands
jabbing drive to mid-off after backing away outside leg
tossed on middle, defended to silly point
short on middle, hops and fends to cover. He wrings his hand in pain
chest-high short ball on middle and leg, Wagner inflicts more pain on the injured Mushfiq. He somehow fends to leg
short ball shading outside off, fended in the air past leg gully
flighted on off, hint of turn, defended with an open face
full and outside off, clears the front leg and shovels a drive to cover
full and angling into a push to mid-on
starts outside off and straightens, tantalisingly close to off, brave leave from Sabbir
bouncer, aimed at the head, Mushfiq ducks under it
bouncer on middle, ducks again

Dropped by Southee diving to his left at leg-gully. He goes with both hands but the ball pops out. Short and rises on leg stump, cramps up the batsman for room. Mushfiq fends it in the air and escapes
fended in the air again this time well wide of Southee
short of a length on middle, kept out
lifter on middle, Sabbir now ducks under
floated up outside off, driven to the left of a wide mid-off
tight line on off, defended on the front foot
steps forward and drives..... into the legs of silly point who takes the blow
even fuller and outside off, seam-up from Santner, stabbed back to him
full and outside off, driven to cover
blocked to silly point, coming forwards
ripping bouncer aimed at the chest, Mushfiq leaps off his feet, throws his hands in front of his face and somehow fends. That should hurt
short on leg, hops, looses his grip, takes his bottom hand off and defends
hip-high short ball, allows him to pull to long leg
fended to short leg
bouncer on leg, ducks under
around the wicket, short, angled in, hops and fends to short leg
flighted and outside off, prodded to the left of silly point
slightly shorter, defended on the back foot
starts outside off and drifts in, paddles and misses
flighted on middle, defended with the bottom hand off the bat
sways his upper body out of the way and evades a short ball outside off
short and angling away, Mushfiq sways away again
fuller now, angling away wide outside off, covers his off stump and lets it go
lifter angling away, more swaying from Mushfiq
not as short as the previous ball, angled in, but Mushfiq's response is the same
good length on off, hangs back and defends to cover
left alone outside off
full and outside off, left alone again
tight line on off, defended
played back to the bowler
full and angled in, kept out
short and slides in with the arm, defended to leg
good length and angled in, defended
swings away outside off, full, left alone
tapped to point
full and angled in, defended
bouncer, angled in, ducks under it
left alone outside off
full and slipping down leg, left alone

Boult drops a return catch to his left. Full and angling away outside off, swings away, from over the wicket, the batsman drives hard and skews it off the inside half. Boult goes with both hands but can't cling on
back of a length and outside off, played with soft hands to gully
short of a length and angling across off, stands tall and punches to cover
full and angling away outside off, gets forward and slices a drive through the covers. Sabbir's first runs in 51 minutes, his first since the 26th over
short on leg stump, ducks under
short and angled across off, ducks under again
lifter, angling away, Mushfiq leaps and spars at it, the ball rolls between gully and backward point
short and angling away, Mushfiq gets under
full on off, pushed through mid-off
short on off, kept out
blocked to cover
full and outside off from around the wicket, pushed to cover
loosens his grip and defends to cover
left alone outside off
short on leg, ducks under
short on leg, fends to leg

131.2ks short ball down leg. Was there a clicking noise? Southee thinks so and NZ review. Sabbir hooks and Watling collects the ball. RTS picks up nothing. The ball seems to have bounced over the bat. Sabbir survives. Umpire Reiffel's on-field not-out call is upheld
sways away from a short ball outside off
fended off the glove to the right of short leg

135.4ks short ball, clatters into the helmet of Mushfiq. He collapses in pain. Mushfiq looks away, takes his eyes off the short ball, and is struck flush on the back of the helmet just behind his left ear. Mushfiq misjudged the bounce here and he looks stunned. NZ's players show concern for Mushfiq; Tamim also runs into the field to check on his team-mate. An ambulance enters the field, Mushfiq is stretchered off.
low full-toss, shapes in, inside-edged onto the pad. Taskin weathers the lbw appeal
full and holds its line outside off, edged between slips and gully. The ball rolls away to the boundary
opens the face and steers to point
half-volley outside off, creamed away to deep cover. Excellent sliding save in the deep from Wagner
short of a length and outside off, jabbed to cover
bouncer, angled in, ducks under it
short and outside off, arches his back and leaves. Taskin is exposed to Southee
full on a sixth-stump line outside off, left alone
pitched up and outside off, poked into the covers
full and holds its line on off, capably defended on the front foot
nice and full outside off, seams away past the outside edge
wide of the crease, holds its line outside off, recklessly slashed past the cordon to the third man fence
back of a length and outside off, stands tall and punches solidly to cover
short and angled into the hips, tucked around the corner
full and outside off, driven on the up, straight to cover
dug short on off, Sabbir gets under it
back of a length and slanting away outside off from over the wicket, left alone
good length and angling away outside off, Taskin opens the face and defends towards point
much fuller and angling away outside off, this length tempts Taskin into driving away from the body. Beaten neck and crop
pitched up and angling away, much closer to off. Taskin had to play at this. Beaten again
full and outside off, drive and a miss in the channel
defended with soft hands to gully
short and wide outside off, flailing cut to the left of sweeper. Wagner can't cut it off
length and outside off, played up to cover
punched away to the left of sweeper for two
full and angling into a solid defence back to the bowler
back of a length and angled in, drops to cover
left alone outside off
pitched up and slanting away past the outside edge
wide enough outside off to let another one go
full and angling across off, Taskin lets it be
full and angled in on off, pushed through mid-off for one
short and down leg, beats the hook, too quick for Sabbir is Southee
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Taskin shoulders arms wisely
tight line on off, Taskin presses forward and defends with a straight bat into the cover region
overpitched on the pads, Taskin cashes in, flicking it away over short leg. Nicely played
third drop of the session. Latham shells it at forward short leg. Full and angled into the pads from over the wicket, Taskin prods in the air. Latham does not stay low, and drops a regulation catch
bowled'em. And Latham will be a relieved man. Ripping reverse-swinging yorker, shoots through the defences of Taskin. No assistance needed from the fielders
full and zipping away outside off, prods and misses
short from around the wicket, Sabbir drops his bat and wears it on the arm
waist-high short ball on middle, Sabbir takes it on and pulls in the air, just short of long leg
keeps it short, angling away outside off, Sabbir looks away. Hooks and does not make contact
length and angling away, Sabbir was expecting the short ball. Fended to cover

Appeal for caught behind. Has Sabbir gloved it behind? Umpire Reiffel's finger goes up. Sabbir chats with his partner and reviews Chest-high short ball down the leg side. Sabbir does not back down from the challenge, although it's the second last ball before lunch. Replays, particularly the side-on angle, show the ball brushed the arm guard and looped behind to the keeper. No bat, no glove involved. Sabbir survives. Umpire Reiffel reverses his on-field call
snorter. Chest-high short ball angling across off. Sabbir is equal to the task. Sways his upper body out of the way
starts off with a sharp short ball, Kamrul takes his eyes off the ball and ducks. He is smacked on the shoulder just below the helmet. NZ continue to pepper Bangladesh with bouncers
follows the short ball with a full one on off. Rabbi keeps this one out
good length and on a fourth-stump line, Rabbi angles out a defence towards point
pitched up on off, Rabbi inches forward and jams his bat down on the ball
short and angling away outside off, 134, Rabbi keeps his eyes on the ball before ducking away
Boult throws it up very full and wide down the leg side. Rabbi attempts a glance but it's very wide down leg
Southee begins with a short ball too, the line is on leg, ducks under it
back of a length on off, defended
Sabbir has timed the pants off this! Full on off, Sabbir reads the length well. He presses forward and unfurls a serene on-drive, straight of mid-on
short and down leg, Sabbir shuffles inside the line and lets it go
hip-high short ball on leg stump, Sabbir directs it to long leg with a simple pull. Rabbi now has to keep out the last ball of this over
good length, hurtles back in, bounces and takes the front pad. Impact in line, but looked like it would bounce over the stumps
full and wider than a set of stumps outside off, nothing doing from Sabbir
hip-high short ball outside off, Sabbir sizes it up and thumps a pull to the right of mid-on. Swatted away with great authority. Moves to 49
second half-century for Sabbir in his first Test away from home! Well done, Sabbir. He takes in the applause from his team-mates. Back of a length and angling away outside off, chopped out to point
full and angling away just a shade outside off, Rabbi covers up in defence
fullish and on middle and leg, resolutely blocked wide of short leg
short of a length and outside off, rides the bounce and punches to cover. He can't pinch the single
full and slanted in on off, prodded to short leg
full and holds its line on off, defended with bat and pad close together
back of a length and angled in, defended on the back foot to short leg
Southee is rewarded for his short-ball barrage. Rabbi takes his eyes off the short ball and ducks into it. The ball thuds into the left glove and pops up in the air, gully snaffles it
he is welcomed by a lifter outside off, Kayes is struggling to duck under it. Somehow does it
take that! Dug in short on middle, injured thigh or not! he steps back and hammers a pull to the square-leg boundary. Heroic stuff from Bangladesh
back of a length and angling away outside off, Sabbir steers the ball to deep point. Kayes can't run, so it's a dot
full and angling away outside off, wild swish and a miss. What are you doing, Sabbir? Calm down

and Sabbir loses his head. Slashed behind. In-between length - neither full nor short - and angling away wide outside off, Sabbir could have left that alone. He flays at it and thickly edges it behind. Dolly for Watling. Impressive innings under pressure from Sabbir nevertheless
full and wider than a set of stumps outside off, ignored
full and angled in, kept out
angles out a defence to point and Roy survives
tests Kayes with a lifter on middle stump, Kayes judges the bounce well enough and sinks under it
short on middle, Kayes attempts to go on the offensive. Steps away outside leg, flails his bat at the ball and misses
charges out, sees a short ball get big on him, top-edges a hook in the air to the right of midwicket
chest-high short ball on leg stump, brings out the pull and hits it hard fine of fine leg
bangs a short ball aimed at the throat, gets big on Kayes again. He aims to pull, then bails out, and fends it in the air. Drops onto the pitch
beats long leg again. Beware the wounded batsman, NZ. Kayes won't run, he can't run. He's dealing in boundaries. Hip-high short ball on leg or just outside, swatted away fine of fine leg again
pitched up and holds its line outside off, left alone
full and much wider outside off, left alone outside off
shortish and on a set of stumps outside off, Roy ignores it
back of a length and angled back in on middle, he stays leg-side of the ball and defends to the right of silly-point

another inswinging yorker, this one from over the wicket, shoots through the defences of Roy. Cracking delivery. It would have nabbed any top-order batsman. Mushfiq isn't here at Basin Reserve, so NZ need 217 in 57 overs
leg-stump half-volley, put away through square leg with the wrists
straying onto the hips of Raval, tucked around the corner
bouncer on off, Latham keeps his eyes on the ball before hunkering down
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, you can still trust the bounce on this track on day five. Holds his bat up and leaves it on length
back of a length on middle and leg, Latham goes back and clips it away to long leg
short of a length, bounces over the off stump, as Raval also leaves on length
tossed-up offbreak outside off, turns away, beats the ambitious drive outside off
offbreak - natural variation - slides on outside off, ignored
full and slides in with the arm just outside off, Latham shapes to play before belatedly letting it pass at the last instant
tossed up on off, bends forward in defence
pitched up on off, quicker through the air, defended on the front foot again
dropped short and wide outside off, Miraz escapes punishment, as Latham only steps back and chops out to point
good length and angled across off stump, Latham protects his off stump and shoulders arms
good length on middle stump, Latham moves forward and defensively drops the ball into the cover region
too straight in line, clipped away to midwicket
bouncer on leg stump, leg-gully is lurking behind, so Latham ducks under it
Latham is super strong behind square either side of the wicket. This is sprayed onto the pads, Latham uses the pace and merrily flicks it away
nice and full, angling across off, Latham leaves it be
offbreak, slides outside off, natural variation, left alone
drifting down the leg side, beats the glance, and sneaks away between the keeper and leg slip for four byes
tight line on off, Raval plays back with the head over the ball
short but keeps low outside off, chops an under-edge to second slip
back of a length and outside off, skips back and punches out to deep point
shorter outside off, goes back and cuts it to backward point
good length and angling away just outside off, even if it had swing in, Raval would not have been in trouble. Left on length
back of a length and outside off, ignored
hip-high short ball outside off, skips back and pulls powerfully to square leg
similar ball outside off, Raval pulls powerfully again. This time he goes up and over midwicket
full and angling away wide outside off, no shot offered
good length, too wide outside off to draw a stroke from Raval
short on off, punched on the back foot past midwicket's left
skidder outside off, rushes Raval on. Goes back and forces it to cover-point
dragged short, goes back and under-edges a pull through his legs, rolls behind square
non-turning offbreak on off, dead-batted
short on the pads, whipped away square through the leg side on the back foot. Large square boundary, and it's just three
full and straight, turned away to the left of midwicket
going down leg, clipped to long leg
looped up on middle, the left-hander plays for some turn, and pokes an outside edge into cover
full and rolls on middle and leg, defended in front of the body
full on the stumps, played back to the bowler again
slower through the air on off, no turn again, dead-batted

throws this up on off stump, very full, driven straight of mid-on. Well-timed, and that ladies and gentlemen is the first runs down the ground from NZ in this innings, in the eighth over. Sums up the lengths Bangladesh have bowled
defended to short leg
flighted on off, dead-batted
flatter and drifts in , steps back and eyes the leg side. A leading edge pops in front of cover
nudged on the front foot to midwicket as this was full on middle
good length ball on middle, gets forward and smothers it
drifting into the pads, worked to the right of leg-slip
straight ball on middle, defended back to the bowler
uses his feet and drives it right back at the bowler
uses his feet again, meets a full ball and clips it to the left of the leg umpire
Miraz strikes with the new ball. Tosses it liberally outside off, invites the drive. Raval is on the move as he chips a return catch
offbreak, 80ks, bounces Williamson aims to turn it to leg, has to settle with an inside-edge onto the pad
tossed on middle and leg, shuffles across off and blocks to leg
now he errs short and outside off, allows Williamson to skip back and punch it away through the practice pitches square on the off side
stretches forward and defends a full ball to short leg
spins in from outside off, Williamson pads up to it
tossed up on middle and leg. Defended
nudged off the pads to the right of a diving leg-slip
low full-toss on off, whipped away to long-on
full on middle, defended to midwicket with a straight bat
defended to leg again as this was full and straight on middle
straight roller, dead-batted
advances down the pitch, meets a full ball and flicks it neatly through midwicket

Two wickets in two overs for Miraz. Played on. Just short of a good length and outside off, indecision costs Latham. He wasn't sure whether to cut or leave. Chops it onto the stumps off an inside edge. Lazy work from Latham
full on the stumps, driven through mid-on, the man is at long-on
shorter and outside off, Williamson skips back, opens up his hips, and cuts away through cover. No indecision, nothing, just precise footwork and timing
worked to the right of short leg
quick fizzer on off, poked back
slides on outside off, Taylor watches it through to the keeper
down the track and driven to short extra cover who throws himself to his right and stops the ball
uses his feet, shortens his length, not close to the pitch. Gingerly pushed to the left of short leg
fractionally short on off, stays low, Williamson goes low with it and controls a pull to deep midwicket
short and skids in, jammed out to leg as Taylor is cramped up for room
short and speared down leg, beats the pull, beats Sabbir, the stand-in keeper
looped up on off, bends forward and dead-bats it. Even a dead bat from Williamson is pretty
slightly short, goes back and blocks with an open face
quicker offbreak, whipped away in the gap at midwicket
full and drifts away outside off, gets forward and drives through the covers with some style
full, no turn, no drift, defended in front of off stump
straight ball on off, plays for the turn and edges it, does not carry to slip
full on middle, played back down the pitch
uses his feet, gets beaten in flight, but adjusts and whips the ball behind square for three
more round-arm than usual, safely negotiated on the back foot
full and straight, defended
punched away to the right of mid-on
slower and drifts in on middle, thrusts the bat in front of the pad in defence
spins into the pads, whipped away with the wrists square through the leg side for three
uses his feet and slices an outside edge through point as he is beaten in flight
slides in faster on middle, hint of drift, defended on the back foot
defended to short leg's right on the back foot
full on middle, defended to short leg again
veers into the pads again whipped away for the second time in the over
short on off, hip-high ball, rolls his wrists and swats behind square
back of a length and angled in, Williamson stands up tall and solidly pushes back to Taskin
full and outside off, carves out a drive to deep point
hip-high short ball outside off, Taylor steps back, gets on top of it, and swats to deep midwicket
very full and wide outside off, sliced out to deep point
lifter on off stump, Taylor looks to swat it to midwicket, can't get on top of it. Top-edges it in the air over leg-slip. Replays show there was no top edge. Hits the helmet and lobs over
tossed up on of, gets forward and blocks with a straight bat
full and straight, pushed back to Shakib
down the track, the ball dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. Driven to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
full on off, drifts in, chipped back to Shakib along the ground
Taylor uses his feet and cracks it back to the bowler again. Shakib throws it to Sabbir, Taylor hurriedly turns back and slides his bat in
short, angled in, kisses the flap of the pad and lobs to leg-slip. Taylor misses a pull. That was begging on its knees to be swatted away
short of a length and outside off, leans back and directs it to deep point
short and wide outside off, flayed to deep point on the back foot
short and outside off, drops his wrists on it
whoa. That air-borne Williamson punch. Short and outside off, leaps off his feet as he meets the ball and regally punches through extra cover
short on off, now he steps back, precise footwork again. Gets on top of it and pulls it superbly to the right of the leg umpire
short and wide outside off, employs some force now, lashing it away through cover-point. Stayed leg-side of the ball and powered it away to the fence
full and drifts in on middle, nudged to leg
shortish on off, calmly punched down to long-on for one
very short and angling into middle and leg, Wiliamson goes deep in the crease. Pulls and finds deep midwickett
shimmies out and quietly defends a shortish ball to short leg
drifting down the leg side, Taylor goes low and does not make contact with a sweep. Too tough for Sabbir behind the stumps
back of a length and arrowed in on off stump, stands up tall and punchily plays it back to the bowler
leans back and carefully places a shortish ball through point
clipped off the pads to midwicket
good length and angled in on off, worked on the back foot to deep midwicket again
dropped short and outside off, leans back and deftly late-cuts it away past lone slip. Quite tricky to bowl with this field
slower through the air on off, the full ball is put away as well. Taylor goes low and uses deft touch again. Lap-sweeps it away fine on the leg side. Nobody there in the deep
full on middle, defended
flighted on off stump, dead-batted
shortish and drifts in, back-foot force to midwicket
sliding across off from over the wicket, late-cut away behind square on the off side
tossed up full on leg stump, defended to where short leg may have been
picked off the pads but straight to square leg on the back foot
half-tracker down the leg side, horrid ball, Taylor rocks back and duly pulls it hard over backward square leg
short and wide outside off, Williamson swivels back and rolls his wrists, pulling along the ground to the square leg fence. NZ need exactly 100 to win. Williamson welcomes Roy with a lovely four
this is even better. Short and outside off, leans back and late-cuts it behind point. Williamson is putting up a masterclass
short on off, hops up and whips it away to the right of mid-on
short and angled in, turned to leg
full and on a fifth-stump line outside off, rare false shot from Williamson. Hangs his bat out and watches the ball pass the outside edge
expertly late-cut between slip and gully. Back of a length and outside off, employs the latest of late-cuts and runs it away in that little gap. #Class. Races to fifty off 43 balls
low full-toss on off, Taylor swats it away to long-on
quick fizzer, defended on the back foot
pushed outside the leg stump, no turn at all, goes low, rolls his wrists and sweeps it behind square
down the track, takes a full-toss, and drives to mid-off
leans back and punches out to the right of sweeper
dangled outside leg, misses the sweep. NZ have plundered 42 in five overs after tea
short and outside off, short-armed away to the wide mid-on boundary
short on a fourth-stump, chopped onto the ground, bounces over the cordon
back of a length and outside off, knocked to cover. Williamson is eager for a single, Taylor holds his bat up and asks his captain to undo his steps
back of a length on middle, worked to midwicket on the back foot
back of a length on off, opens the face, stays leg-side of the ball and runs the ball to cover
jabbed away towards point for the hundred partnership - the first between Williamson and Taylor at home in Test cricket
tossed up just outside leg, no turn, Taylor prods it away off the inside edge to the right of diving leg-slip
sashays down the track, takes a half-volley, and drills it down to long-on
low full-toss on off, driven back to the bowler. Off the toe-end I suppose
short and speared down leg, Taylor would have swatted this half-tracker to the boundary nine out of 10 times. Misses out this time
full on the leg stump, poked to midwicket
full on middle, played back to the bowler
just short of a good length on off, wow, look at this wristwork. Jumps off his feet and manipulates the ball to the right of mid-on
too full and straight, whipped around the corner for one
short and wide outside off rides the bounce and beautifully late-cuts to square third man
full and outside off, sliced away to deep backward point
full and outside off, hits through the line, driven to mid-off on the front foot
very full on off, near yorker, dug out
good length on middle, pushed away to midwicket
slides on outside off, Taylor now brings out a late-cut. Deep backward point jogs across to his left, is lazy to bend down, just escorts the ball to the boundary
too full on off, defended
non-turning offbreak on off, blocked back down the pitch
full on the stumps, worked to midwicket
slider on middle, bunted down to long-on
cuts a short ball from outside off to deep point
back of a length and swings in a bit, stands tall and punches to mid-off
bouncer on middle, ducks under it
back of a length on off, worked to leg
bouncer outside off, Williamson is caught between ducking and ramping. Does a bit of both and misses the ball
short and outside off, gets on top of it and pulls to deep midwicket. Sends the seagulls fluttering away
here comes Williamson! Down the track and simply chips it in the air with the spin to the right of midwicket. Cries of 'catch it', but there's no stopping him today
looped up outside off, driven inside-out to the left of wide mid-off and to the right of extra cover. What a flowy drive. Flat-batted away, much like the Kohli whiplash
whipped from outside off to square leg
fired outside off, Williamson wafts away from the body and misses (rubs my eyes, looks at the replay, yes, he misses it)
short of a length on middle and leg, stands tall and punches a single to long-on
short and outside off, skiddy delivery, Taylor rocks his head out of the way
steps back to meet a short ball. Punched away to the right of deep backward point
tripe short ball outside off, cut away, but there is deep backward point to cut that off
gets on top of a short ball outside off and caresses it away to deep backward point
chest-high short ball on off, Taylor is up on his tippy toes as he pats it onto the pitch with no fuss
pitched up and outside off, driven on the up. Cracked straight to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, steps back and punches it crisply to the right of deep point. Mahmudullah does not dive, boots the ball into the field of play
short and outside off, Taylor lines it up and brings up his fifty - his first after the eye surgery - with his favourite swat-pull to deep midwicket
good length and on off stump, Williamson shows off his straight bat
full and outside off, gets forward, meets the pitch and laces a drive to cover-point
short of a length and seams back in to cramp Williamson for room. Chopped towards third man
lifter outside off flat-batted away to the right of midwicket. Taylor did pretty well to keep it down
short of a length and outside off, square-cut away for one
full-toss straying down leg - the yorker went awry - tickled fine on the leg side past the keeper's left
wide of the crease, angles a full ball onto the leg stump, deflected square on the leg side

very full and angling into leg stump, Taylor can't connect with a flick, and wears it on the front pad on the knee-roll. He falls over. This looks like it's heading down leg with the sharp angle from over the stumps. No inside snick. Desperate review from Bangladesh. Yep, going down leg. Surprisingly, the umpire gave it as a run, no inside-edge, not hitting the stumps either
chopped to gully
tickled from leg stump as the ball rolls away fine on leg
tight line on off, defended back with a straight bat
short and wide outside off, reaches out and carves it over the top of slip. Enters the nineties
overpitched and outside off, top-quality drive down the ground, mid-off throws himself to his right to intercept the ball
lifter outside off, swatted away to deep midwicket
length and outside off, glided to gully
full and angled in on off, shuffles across in defence
goes wide of the crease and errs in length. Half-volley outside off, Williamson eases forward and nails a cover-drive
back of a length and outside off, a back-foot chop to deep backward point ensues
short and outside off, jumps up and whiplashes it to deep midwicket. Very, very wristy Mr. Williamson
half-tracker outside off, bashed away through backward point. Rasping cut from Taylor
might full on off, near yorker, cuts in, jabbed away along the ground for one
short of a length and outside off, bounces up over the attempted cut of Taylor

an appeal for lbw, umpire Erasmus shakes his head. 140ks, tinge of reverse, tails in sharply and strikes the inside of the pad. Taylor was late on it. Probably grazing leg. Good shout, but Bangladesh don't review. The tracker shows it would have carried onto hit leg stump
short, hurries off the pitch, Taylor is late onto the pull. Raps him above the thigh
yorker, reverses in, squeezed out
Ouch. Taylor is hit on the box and is floored. Short of a length and skids into Taylor, who is late onto the pull again.
full and angled in on off, clipped to midwicket
short and outside off, reaches out and cuts fine of deep backward point
full on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket

Miraz pulls off a stunner. Shortish and outside off, throws his hands at a cut. The outside edge flies to the right of second slip. Miraz dives full-length to his right and plucks it out with both hands. Needed some brilliance to end this stand. But it's all too late for the tourists
full and angling away, driven to extra cover
punched through the line to mid-off
full and angled in on off, Williamson dabs to cover and cries 'no' to Nicholls
veering into the pads, whipped with the wrists to deep square leg. Williamson looks for two, no just one
full and angling across off, left alone
short and outside off, Nicholls joins the party. Steps back and hammers a pull to the midwicket boundary. He is pretty strong off the back foot
full-toss very, very wide outside off, Nicholls swishes away from the body, can't touch it. Sabbir is beaten to his left as the ball rolls away to the boundary
very wide outside off, left alone. Standing ovation for a dot. Williamson's century is still on
back of a length on off, tapped away straight to midwicket on the back foot
length ball on off, dabs a cut to point and oh well, he takes the single
full and angling away outside off, left alone. The Wellington crowd warmly cheers that leave from Nicholls
full and outside off, run away off a controlled outside edge to gully
short and wide outside off, jumps and chops it hard to gully
another round of cheers, this time for a solid forward defensive to a full, straight ball
full on leg stump, skips out and pushes to mid-on
straight ball on middle, some drift in the air, dead-batted

Hundred for Williamson off only 89 balls in the fourth innings! Whadda Playaaa. Tossed on leg or just outside leg - this line has not worked at all for Bangladesh - goes low and sweeps it with the wrists through square leg. Standing ovation for the NZ captain and deservedly so. Nicholls gives his captain a big hug. Great scenes at Basin Reserve. If you've missed this gem of the innings, please catch the highlights. This is a special innings
short and sliding across off from around the wicket, steps back and shovels it away to deep midwicket to put the seal on an incredible come-from-behind New Zealand win
